33798958.review:
Software Inc. is a mix of a Sims-like construction planner and a very UI-based economy simulation. I personally enjoyed every minute of my roughly 45 hours of playthrough, but I now reached the point where my company has achieved everything that could be considered a challenge. From this experience I can very much recommend the game to very patient simulation players with a liking for strategic details.

Many negative reviews say that the UI is badly designed ond convoluted. Despite the learning curve being pretty steep I had no problems at all with the UI - most things are pretty much self-explanatory, you just have to take the time to explore it a bit and read the tooltips. The tutorial was helpful to me, I just did not like that it made me read tutorials for very advanced features I would not need anyway until mid or end game. But I never used a third party guide or even tips from the forums and still "won" the game with my first company.

On the other hand, some of the mechanics just don't work at the moment or are pretty hard to control (e.g. connecting server farms, especially large ones, assigning workplaces to specific workers and some of the building tools). 

What I liked about the game is the interplay of building and team logistic. There are several ways to make your software firm efficient (e.g. choosing between the "one-team-per-franchise" or the "one-team-per-role" organization or the decision between large cubicle-office vs. small room offices). All strategies require different building styles and development chains.

But all of this interesting stuff is mid to late game content. In the beginning of the game, the excitement of whether your company will make the release in time to pay the bills might keep you entertained, but at the same time the endless cycle of production -> dumb minigames -> marketing -> reinvestment (until you finally manage to satisfy the market demands) feels dull after a while. Once you find your software niche, it starts to get interesting with respect to team and building management, but if you succeed, there is really nothing you could do wrong anymore. Your first real hit software will most of the time give you an enormous financial boost. All of a sudden, you won't ever look at a price tag again. Only the best is good enough and of course you will never release a piece of software too early so that your work will always result in "outstanding" software. But where's the fun if everything you do is always "outstanding"?

The game starts in the year 1980. At around 2003 I had a perfect market recognition and millions of fans for every single type of product. There were no more new features to unlock that I could add into new releases and there was no more research to be conducted to stay ahead of the competitors. Instead, I turned so insanely rich that I would just buy every IP from my competitors that could even remotely threaten my monopoly. That was the point were I considered the game finished (with the only feature left to explore being a holo computer in the year 2020 for my workers that would slightly increase programming speed and with the only thing left to do being to earn more money until I could buy every single firm)

The graphics of the game seemed odd at first, but you really grow to like the simplistic models. It might not be state of the art, but the design is definitely cute and the exaggerated animations are worth a chuckle. Unfortunately there was no music yet.

Gameplay: 7/10
Graphics: 6/10
Stability and bugs: 8/10

33666055.review:
游戏最有意思的部分还是在前期创业阶段，包括建筑设计，前期外包积累现金，以及选择何种软件作为自己的开发方向。这其中包括现金流、市场、竞争环境、软件发布历史、版权、公司股票等决策元素。如果初期开发方向决策正确，前两三个软件就能卖到10M美金，盖个大楼，组件6 7个团队，项目管理自己来，人员委托给项目经理，顺利进入发展扩张阶段。

我基本上就是在反复玩这个游戏的初期直到现金20-50M美金，因为往后的游戏就比较鸡肋，专注一类软件开发，买下竞争对手版权，形成垄断（同类软件没人开发，自己版权卖不出去）。一个软件定价十几万（再高我没试过），发布几年以后用户照单全收，单个软件利润7000B，后期基本上就是挂机数钱的游戏。

卡？不存在的，早就裁到了100人，一个团队，两层楼。

一点小建议
1）游戏中的软件开发最好重结果，轻过程。每一个玩家扮演的都是公司管理者，而不是码农，不必经历整个设计调试debug阶段，后期软件从立项开发到上市销售一个多小时，而且为了加快上市时间，立项往往暂停进行，而建造也是暂停进行，导致整个游戏过程都是玩家在等待开发的过程。玩家什么也做不了没有丝毫游戏乐趣。

2）游戏后期应该多些新内容，比如公司到一定规模之后可以在交易中当甲方，负责研究，将开发冗长的过程交给乙方，简化后期漫长的开发流程以及人员过1000后带来的卡顿问题。现在的后期只是重复过程，公司并没有因为声望，粉丝，产品带来质的改变。

33525727.review:
Tout comme vous, je passe des journées entières a jouer à certains jeux, en m'amusant ou me déchirant le crâne par la réflexion, mais jamais je me suis poser la question sur tout le développement dérrière, les idées, l'entreprise, le fonctionnement ... Et bien ce jeu répond à certaines de mes questions, bienvenue sur Software Inc.

[h1]De studio à gratte-ciel[/h1]

Vous imaginez bien, tout les grands créateurs de nos jours ont commencer d'une cave, ou un garage : ici, les développeurs sont bien plus clément, votre démarrage est customisable, vous déciderez avant tout de la tronche de votre PDG (c'est important de savoir si vous êtes un beauf en short ou bien un homme d'affaires bien habillé) pour ensuite choisir un des scénarios, sachant qu'il est fortement recommandé en pleine liberté. Après avoir cliquer sur quelques boutons pour définir les paramètres de votre partie, ainsi que de vos caractéristiques (qui comportent de nombreux facteurs), vous serez enfin lancer en 1970, à l'aube de l'ère informatique !

Et bim ! Vous voilà sur un terrain de petite taille, a devoir construire votre propre petit studio avec vos fonds, et commencer a faire quelques contrats pour des entreprises en plein développement afin de vous faire des fonds supplémentaires.

Au far à mesure de votre bourse, les choses deviendront plus compliqué, bien que vous ayez une liberté totale sur la création de votre studio (que ce soit de la forme, de l'équipe), il vous sera nécessaire de satisfaire les besoins de vos employés et de travailler en fonction de leurs compétences et de l'actualité (car le jeu est très dynamique par la concurrence qui souhaite vous en mettre dans les roues !).

[h1]La prise en main[/h1]

Le point le plus important est la prise en main : par sa tendance graphique assez cubique, on porte à croire que le jeu est très spécifique, mais je ne peux que vous recommandé d'acheter ce jeu et d'appuyer sur tout les boutons !

En téléchargeant avant tout le patch français (qui est constamment mis à jour) et en suivant quelques vidéos (dont celles de Bill Silverlight, par exemple), vous comprendrez très rapidement comment le jeu fonctionne, bien que la perfection semble encore lontaine, vous développerez votre créativité à travers la beauté de votre studio (le workshop est rempli de petits génies et architectes qui font de jolis structures) ou bien dans la formation d'équipes spécialisées dans certaines tâches.

Tout les boutons sont souvent accompagnés d'explication, ou bien d'une icône qui vous fera comprendre leur sens. La partie la plus intéressante, la construction, est très facile à prendre en main, puisqu'il est basé sur un système de case (à la sims) qui sont ajustable selon les meubles, les murs, etc...

Les interfaces sont toujours semblables, elles sont très visible, facile à lire, aucun soucis là dessus, la couleur blanche très légère ne détruit pas la rétine au bout de quelques heures de jeux.

[h1]La curiosité et la facilité[/h1]

En apprenant à faire un empire de l'informatique, vous aurez le plaisir de travailler votre créativité et vouloir toujours faire plus, et mieux organisés. Dans mon cas, j'ai adoré construire différents bâtiments, tous différents, avec des parkings spécifiques et des bureaux adaptés à mes équipes.

Hélas, à un certain point, le jeu devient presque trop facile : à part suivre l'évolution des années (qui prend quand même, plusieurs heures), les revenues sont conséquent, et parfois les projets sont répétitifs.

Le Early Game est bien plus tripant que le Late Game.

[h1]Indépendant mais constamment en développement[/h1]

Bien que petit, ce jeu est toujours travailler par son créateur qui souhaite apporter le maximum de contenu liée au monde de l'informatique, par exemple, il y a quelque mises à jours est apparut la vente physique de jeux, logiciels... C'est des ajouts au Gameplay qui donne envie de revenir constamment sur des nouvelles parties afin de voir ce qu'il offre.

En enquétant sur le développement du jeu, j'ai appris qu'un Trello était disponible : Le Trello est un site regroupant tout ce qui est en cours de travail par des petites cartes ce qui permet au développeur de trier ses projets, on peut ainsi suivre les progrès et voir les idées que certains joueurs ont eu.

[h1]Prix et recommandation[/h1]

C'est une petite merveille pour un studio aussi petit, il mérite son prix, et je le recommande grandement au fan de gestion/simulation !

33300541.review:
Software Inc 
 
뭔가 심즈나 기타 경영 게입을 합친것 처럼 소프트웨어 회사를 운영하는 게임 입니다.
디자인 , 프로그래밍 , 아티스트 , 홍보 , 등등 많은 분야의 훌륭한 직원들을 채용하여
회사를 꾸려 나갑니다. 이런 기본적인 직원 외에 요리 담당 , 정비담당 , 청소 담당 등의 스태프 또한 뽑을 수도 있습니다.
회사에 직원을 위한 사내보험을 들어주지 않으면 높은 등급의 직원들을 고용 할 수 없다는 상세한 설정도 있습니다. 
 
본인의 회사를 꾸밀 수 있고  앞서 말한 직원들이 회사의 업무를 진행하는데 있어서 적합한 환경을 구성해주어야 합니다.
환풍기를 설치하거나 에어컨을 설치하거나 또는 난방기구를 설치하여 온도를 조절하고 창문을 설치하거나 전등을 설치해서 어둡지 않게 해주어야 합니다. 
 
사실 이런 기본적인 컨텐츠는 너무나 단순하고 당연한거고 본격적인 회사 운영 컨텐츠가 재미있는게 본인이 직접 소프트웨어를 개발하여 출시하고 홍보하여 판매 수익을 얻는 방법이 있는 반면 외주를 받아서 업무를 처리해주거나 혹은 서버를 운영하는 방식으로도 돈을 벌 수 있습니다. 
 
게임을 개발한다고 치면 게임 엔진을 사용해야하고 운영체제를 선택해야 하는데 이때 사용하는 운영체제나 게임 엔진의 사용자 수 , 성능 등을 고려해야하고 최신의 것들은 저작권료를 많이 내야합니다.  
 
게임 공간속에 있는 많은 회사들이 개발해내는 운영체제 , 오피스 소프트웨어 , 게임 엔진 등등 서로서로 영향을 받게끔 구성이 되어 있고 시장에 출시하지 않고 회사 내수용으로만 사용하는것도 가능합니다. 
 
시대가 흐르면서 흑백 컴퓨터에서 최신 컴퓨터까지 시대가 발전하는 맛도 느낄 수 있습니다. 
 
추가로 창작마당에 있는 컨텐츠를 활용하여 하드웨어도 개발할 수 있습니다.
AMD 컨셉을 잡고 그래픽 카드를 마구 만들어 보세요!

33252185.review:
This game is really entertaining because it synergises the best parts of The Sims with a tycoon.

I've started small, did some contract work to earn cash, eventually assembled a small team, made a first small success, assemled a bigger team and got some proper marketing going. Finished the project by a hair's breadth before running out of money, turned out to be a massive hit, earned 280 million overnight.

Kept adding teams and marketing until I became a too-big-to-fail behemoth churning out every type of software available, housed in two office towers. 

Other companies researched patented technology before I managed to do it, so I bought them out of spite, now I own all of the patents.

Of course this game need more balancing, as it seems waaay to cheap to build and maintain buildings, and needs some more content as well, but the mechanics are quite satisfying, building is fun and has a lot of leeway.

The UI, as mentioned in most reviews, is the weakest part of the whole game. The amount of times I I spent clicking individual furniture items (because you cannot drag-select) seems longer than the age of the universe, and you cannot undo an errors. That is highly frustrating, but fortunately didn't turn me away from the game.

And it's really fun to watch your little wage slaves run around doing work for you.
In other words, I'll probably stop playing in a few hours, when I've finally done everything I could currently do in the game, but I already know I will definitely come back to it.

33240263.review: First, I will say I'm a sucker for tycoon-esque games. I've played several titles with software development in mind, but nothing has come close to Software Inc. It's definitely the exception; considering it's only one man behind development, he's doing a fantastic job. You build your software empire literally from the ground-up, including hiring, firing, overseeing projects, acquiring IPs, striking deals with other software companies, and more. There are so many possibilities with Software Inc. and I can't wait to see what's to come. To add: Apparently I've invested nearly 65 hours on Alpha 8. Just be aware you can't port your saves from Alpha 8 to Alpha 9 yet. I'm hoping this is fixed very soon.

33213522.review: If you always wanted more control of your Sims when you sent them to work, or wanted to be a people or project manager, this game is for you.   Or if you're a Prison Archtect fan, this game is the next level of depth in that genre.  Crazy good stuff here.

33211271.review: I must say, I've really been enjoying these indie games lately, and this is no exception. Software Inc. is a recent addition to my library, and even with in early access it's an amazing game. Similar to other games like the better known Game Dev Tycoon, Software Inc. is a business management game, with a dash of the Sims. Players build their own offices and manage the needs of their employees while making video games, anti-virus and office software, aand even your own OS. Being an early access game, there are bugs, and with the seemingly limited content can sometimes can feel a bit repitive after awhile, but it's an extremely stable game, and I've yet to run into any problems as far as crashing or other issues go. There's also a modding community for it which has added new furniture, software types, and even the ability to make hardware. Overall I really recommend this game. Even in it's incomplete state it offers some good, solid entertainment, and you can build an office that uses only Windows 98 computers.

33160516.review:
Software Inc is an amazing game. Even the graphics are good for a game which has a birds-eye gameplay style.

I recently bought this game because I saw a few videos on it. I absolutely loved the look and feel of the game when I first started to play it, the entire concept of the game is unique; you can't really find another game like this on Steam where you need to build up a Software development company whilst avoid going bankrupt and mantaining certain needs in rooms and keeping all your employees happy and fed. The UI's (User Interface) is also very clean and almost never get in the way of your game, if they do, it can be easily dragged out of the way.

Yes, this game is easily worth the price set, in my opinion. I also love how many different choices you can make in this game. Just in case you do get bored of the items you have, you can download mods for the game, like furniture, building blueprints, software and hardware expansions all of these I deem very useful.

One thing I'm not particularly happy about is the fact how you can't have more than 1 saved game. Perhaps you can toggle it or something, but I have a feeling I'm being dumb. 

In conclusion, Software Inc is an amazing game with a lot of variety of designs and different Softwares, the graphics are good for a game like this and the sounds are also lovely. The fact how you need to mantain different needs in each room is also great, and the endless possiblites you can do in this game goes through the roof.

33077951.review:
Alpha 9 review...

Software Inc is a great game!

It reminds me of playing FTL in terms of its originality, and that the game has so much depth due to the constant decisions that you have to make. There are just so many different ways to build and manage your own company in Software Inc - and you do feel like you are the captain responsible for the ship. Awesome bits:

You are never bored - there is always something to do.
You constantly have to make wighted decisions. 
And the decisions are all yours - Stay small or grow big? Specialise or branch out? Go cautiously or risk it?
The game feels alive with the staff and their actions.
There is just enough micro management not to feel overwhelmed - like rolling mini problems to solve.
You get to build what and how you like.
Mod support! (already some awesome mods).
I think about how I could play the game even when I am not playing.
Just 5 more minutes....
...dang that was two hours ago.
 
Just get it. 10/10

33068206.review:
I love tycoon and management games, and Software Inc is the best I've played for quite awhile!

It is very satisfying going from a startup company with just yourself in basically a hovel, to a small success with a few employees and luxuries (like a toilet, heater, and coffee machine) to a monstorous multinational with hundreds of employees, gobbling up your competition and dominating the market.

I strongly suggest watching a few let's plays while you play, to get the hang of things. Because the tutorials and info on the game is a little lacking at the moment.

Things get a bit too easy too quickly after your first "big" success, you don't really have to worry about money anymore after that, but it's still fun to build and expand.

The game also runs great and has very few bugs or glitches.

I can definitely see myself sinking a lot of time into this game in a borderline OCD kind of way, which is basically what you want from a tycoon game.

33061723.review:
The game is great with alpha 8
Alpha 9 needs more time

This game IS EXTREMELY DIFFICULT WITH ALPHA 9! When I first bought the game it started me out on alpha 8 and it was the best experience I have had in this game. I built a nice compnay with 50+ workers and many products and buildings. When I saw that there was alpha 9 and i opted into it I was displeased. The game got 50 billions times harder and I was never able to grow a company again. My BIGGEST GRIPE with this game in terms of alpha 9 is the new development system. In Alpha8 you had a little bar that referenced how the project was going. It was simple and clean and allowed me to work on other things while I watched that meter grow. NOW, your work is repesented in units of code or art. You will start developing your software and it will start growing, however you have no idea about when to stop. You could just get a review in from your team, but its just a biased review. You can try outsourcing this review but it costs buttloads of money which can hurt you in the early game. Which is the reason why I dont use it.

tl;dr:
basically what i'm trying to get at here is that the development part of the game is extremely confusing and hard to judge. Everything else seems a lot better though.

Jeśli uważasz, że wszystkie gierki związane z tworzeniem gier (Game Dev Tycoon, Mad Games Tycoon) są za proste i potrzebujesz czegoś bardziej złożonego to Software Inc. jest dla ciebie. So ... Un jeu bien, qui manque encore un peu de contenu en l'état principalement dans la phase construction mais nous pouvons pardonner ça grâce au workshop. Pour ce prix c'est un achat qui pourra ravir les fans de simulation qui se veulent réalistes.

le positif :

- Gestion des équipes (humeur, caractère, spécialisation etc...)
- Multiples façettes de gameplay avec la possibilité de dev des softwares en tout genre; moteur 2D, 3D, jeu classique, OS, anti-virus etc avec diverses personnalisations.
- Possibilité de faire des profits par la finance, les accords commerciaux ou encore la distribution.
- Le système à la sims pour la construction (très basique) plaisant

Négatif:

- Une fois compris le truc, quasi impossible de ne pas sortir un "hit" directement et qui va propulsé votre F1 en immeuble en 10 min tournant sur plusieurs équipes.  
- Ambiance musicale proche du néant
- la durée de certaines productions sont vraiment .... voilà. même avec l'équivalent d'une équipe pour gérer une centrale nucléaire vous passerez plusieurs longues minutes à accélérer le temps en ne faisant rien. 
- l'impact de votre personnage de départ est inexistant très rapidement et ne permet pas de s'identifier


Un 6.5/10 , j'espère vraiment que le jeu continuera à être dev car il est vraiment prometeur. 
PS: aucun bug à signaler

32618977.review:
ゲーム内容
ソフトウェア制作会社を立ち上げ、OSや、ゲームアプリ、その他を市場に供給。その資産を使用して
自社ビルを建設、さらに多くの社員を雇って拡大経営を行う。現状ではエンディングという概念はない。

総評としては、面白いゲームだと思いますが、アーリーアクセスであることを前提に内容について
良かった点、そうでない点をレビューしたいと思います。

良かった点
とにかく、ビルディングが面白い。カラーリングや、構造の自由度が絶妙で見ているだけで楽しい。
特に、全面ガラス張りのビルとかできるのでテンションが上がる。
窓が繋がるのがほんとに地味だけど素晴らしい。
シムピープルとかリムワールドとか、テーマパークが好きな人は間違いなく好き。
オフィスビルを3D建設できるソフトって実は私これ以外に知らないので、そういう意味でも楽しい。

良くなかった点
現状ゲームバランスがあまりよろしくない。
ハードウェアの原価の概念がないので、どんだけでも安くハードを供給することができる。
さらに、生産量という概念もないので掘っ立て小屋同然の会社でも全世界に商品が供給できてしまう。
１９８０年の設定でこれはさすがにいただけない。
ダンピングでOSを行き渡らせられれば、あとは無双出来てしまう。

ビルの構造があまり、生産に影響しない。デフォルトで２４時間を１ヶ月の単位で扱うため、食堂や
エレベーターの利用率がリアルではない。
軸足がソフトウエア開発にあるため、ビルの効率性（エレベーターの数、トイレの数、非常階段の有無、消火設備etc）
にフォーカスしきれていない。素晴らしいビルディングが付いているのにこれは非常にもったいない。

32617291.review:
本遊戲主要是模擬經營一間矽谷公司，你可以決定要研發軟體，還是開發硬體，或是像google一樣購買伺服器來經營雲端服務，目前完成度較高的部份是在開發軟體的部份，其他硬體開發的部份大置上與軟體相同，只有在銷售的部份不太一樣，伺服器代管的玩法目前只有買硬體和接受代管，還沒有很完整的功能。
雖然仍在EA中，但是是個極具潛力的模擬遊戲，而且也有MOD工作坊加持，可玩性也大為增加，目前MOD的方向主要以新的家具，以及更多的研發科技樹兩方面為主。

接下來提到身為遊戲主體的軟體開發過程，遊戲在開發軟體時，需先決定軟體的功能，例如開發遊戲時，是要做2D的遊戲，還是3D的遊戲，是否支援可模組化，有沒有QA，音訊採用8bit還是HD…等等。
決定功能也會決定需要的支援軟體；像是做2D遊戲 時就需要有2D圖形輯編器的授權，3D則需要3D圖形輯編器的授權，可模組化需要模組編輯器，音訊則需要音頻編碼器，決定QA則會縮短開發時間，但是會需要進行授後品質維護，以上提到的授權，你可以自已白手起家一路研發自用，也可以直接購買市場上現有的產品，這些授權軟體的品質也會引響你的最終成品；遊戲中還有各式各樣可以開發的軟體，會需要用到各式各樣的軟體授權，而且工作坊也有玩家持續在增加與支援這個部份，可玩性相當大。

接下來提到目前遊戲的幾個缺點，或是可以改進的地方：[list]
[*]專案經理的自動開發專案，不能自訂想要的名稱，不能自訂想要的開發內容，更不能變更行銷計劃，雖然會自動幫你從設計開發到debug和上市，但是過程只有一開始決定時間、金錢與品質之外就沒了，原本自定開發可以選的一堆功能也都不能變更，完全由電腦幫你決定。

[*]人力資源經理的培訓設定太過反人類，居然要設定成負值才能進行培訓，-1是同時最多1人培訓，-5則是5人。

[*]行銷部門的管理太單調，你只需要將一堆有銷售技能的人丟在同一部門即可，也不用專案經理，也不用HR，一堆人丟在那裡就可以行銷到天荒地老了。

[*]遊戲中的員工十分好打發，只要給他吃，給他喝，在辨公室中放顆樹，再給他一杯好咖啡，加上配有人力資源經理協調的話，基本上該員工的心理素質就會一直在96%~100%，工作效率在200%以上，這似乎有點不太對…。

[*]研究可以得到的專利，雖然要跟電腦進行研發競賽才能得到，不過電腦大多不是放著專利不管，不然就是時間到了就帶著專利出場，目前專利的部份看起來只有收受權利金的成份，似乎並沒有需要得到專利之後才能進行某相開發制作的樣子，而且專利可以透過併購公司直接獲得，與後期就能賺大錢後的軟體開發相比，與其花人力資源去研發專利，還不如直接買下專利還來的快又有效率。

[*]市場經濟的部份，電腦的AI十分無力，你可以直接將市場上所有的相同的產品買下來，然後放在家裡不銷售，只賣你自已的產品，就達到壟斷，市場壟斷後每個月可以給你非常巨大的收入，讓你可以把世界上所有其他的產品都收到手裡，再壟斷新的市場，至此遊戲就差不多可以結束了，因為除了你以外的公司再也活不下去了。

[*]股票的部份，遊戲中公司的股價是由該公司有擁有的錢來決定，當你買下一堆股票後，該公司變有錢了，股價自然上漲，但你也可以等到他開發軟體沒錢之後再一口氣併購他即可，並且在遊戲裡如果你從一開始就沒有釋股到市場上的話，根本不用擔心公司會被電腦併購。

[/list]
正如前面所言，此遊戲仍在EA開發中，但是卻有十分的可玩性，如果前述的幾點都能有改善的話，加上工作坊玩家的創意，此遊戲想必會十分有趣。

32608733.review:
[i]06/21現在の最新バージョン、ALPHA-9におけるレビューです。[/i]
[h1]～どんなゲーム？～[/h1]
　ゲーム発展途上国（またはGameDevTycoon）とザ・シムズの建築要素を混ぜたものにThe Towerのビル設計要素をほんの少し足したようなゲームだと思いました。
　基本はソフト会社を立ち上げ、従業員が効率良く作業出来るオフィスビルを設計し、ソフトを作って利益を得るゲームです。
　変わり種として、ソフト製作の受注や、他社ソフトの宣伝・サーバーなどの請負だけで経営することも一応可能です。

[h1]～ソフトを作る～[/h1]
　OS（パソコン・ゲーム機・携帯電話）・ペイントツール・オーディオツール・ポリゴンツール・ゲームソフト・ゲームエンジンなど色々作れます。
　中には年代が進まないと解禁されないものもあります。
　大抵のソフトは他のソフトと連携していて、お互いの売上にも関わります。
（例えば、どんなに素晴らしいソフトでも対応OSが普及してないと売れませんが、そのソフト目当てにOSを買う人が多少発生するといったように）
　大抵は他社のソフトよりも高品質で、多機能で、安く、宣伝されたソフトは多く売れますが、そうではないこともあります。
　最初は見向きもされなかったのに口コミで徐々に売れて、そのまま市場を独占するソフトになることもあります。

[h1]～ソフト開発会社経営～[/h1]
　設定の所持金に達するとクリア扱いにするシナリオ（？）はありますが、基本的に目標はありません。
自分で目標を設定して楽しむタイプのゲームで、
[list]
 [*]自分の考えたソフトを大ヒットさせる
 [*]ライバル会社のシェアを奪って市場を独占してみる
 [*]素敵な/実用的なデザインのオフィスを建ててみる
 [*]数百人の従業員を雇って利益を出す大企業を目指してみる
 [*]請負だけで経営する
[/list]
などが目標になると思います。
　所持金がマイナスになった状態で数日経過するか、借金が膨らみすぎるとゲーム終了です。

[h1]～オフィス設計～[/h1]
　シムズのように部屋を作ったり、家具を置いたり、壁紙や床を変えたり出来ます。
　お金がかかりますが、建築モードには右下の方にアンドゥボタンがあるので間違えても大丈夫。
　数百人が過ごす高層ビル（地下1、地上10、屋上1階まで）を建ててみたり、快適そうなオフィスを建ててみたり、おかしなデザインの建物を作ったり、色々やれます。
　トイレや家具さえ揃っていれば大して経営面にプラスの要素は無いので、経営重視なら殺風景で息苦しくなるようなオフィスでも全く問題ありません。
　しかし自分の設計したオフィスを従業員がちょこまか動きまわるのを眺めるのは楽しいものです。

[h1]～巨大会社運営～[/h1]
　会社が巨大化し、従業員数が多くなってくると、プレイヤーが一々ソフト開発を指示したり、人員を割り振ったりするのは面倒になります。
　そんなときには、従業員をチームで分けたり、複数のチームをプロジェクトに組み込んで、自動でソフト開発から発売まで任せたり、指定の人数・給料で従業員を新しく雇うように人事を割り当てたりも出来ます。
　企画部門・開発部門・広報部門・お客様サポート部門・人事部門といったように組織化させれば、より効率良く会社を運営出来ます。
　各チームを部屋に割り振ることも出来るので、現実の大企業のように部門ごとに建物を分けるなんてオシャレな事もやれます。
　従業員の就業時間帯や休暇日も設定出来るので、24時間年中無休体制で稼働し続けるオフィスも作れます。
　マシンのスペックにもよるかもしれませんが、600人程度までは従業員を雇ってもゲームが重くなったりはしません。
　やろうと思えば多数のプロジェクトを回して、眺めているだけで年に何本ものソフトをリリースする企業も作れます。
（ソフト開発は人員を多く割り振れば早く出来るというものでもなく、多すぎると逆に開発が混乱したり、バグが増加してクレームが殺到したりするので、企画・開発チームは小分けすることになります。）
　どんどん会社が成長していく感覚は経営ゲームプレイヤーなら楽しめるでしょう。

[h1]～問題点～[/h1]
　難点として、全体のチュートリアルが少なく、初めて何かを行うときにそれに関するガイドが表示される形式なので初めてプレイする際は不親切さを感じると思います。
　難易度も軌道に乗るまでは割りとシビアなので、勝手がわかるまで何度も倒産（ゲームオーバー）の憂き目を見て理不尽さを感じるかもしれません。（私は見ました。）
特にソフトを自分で作って売るとなると、
発売日の予測、企画、設計、宣伝、マスコミにソフトを送る、印刷、発売後のサポート、チームの管理etc.…
とやることが非常に多く、初回プレイでこれをこなせる人はいないと思います。
　また、建築モードにおいてもアンドゥボタンの存在や、「部屋の同種の家具を全て選択」「建物の家具を全て選択」「まとめて置換」出来ることに気が付かないとパソコンのアップグレードやサーバーの接続がとても面倒くさいですが、その説明は自分で探さないとありません。
　そして逆に、経営が軌道に乗ると特に障害らしい障害は無くなり、利益を出し続けるだけになります。こうなると経営に関してやることは無くなるので、飽きてしまうかもしれません。例えばシムシティ(Skylines)では大都市になると渋滞問題が発生するとか、ザ・タワーでは人の混雑が激しくなるとか（このゲームのエレベーターは無限に人を運べます。）の軌道に乗ってからの楽しみ方が無いので、今後はそういうのが追加されれば良いと思います。

[h1]～総評～[/h1]
　経営要素は少々大味で、音楽とグラフィックはまだ拙く（バージョンが上がる毎に良くなってはいます）、家具・パターンの種類もちょっと少ないですが、早期アクセスゲームであることを踏まえると十分おもしろい、完成が楽しみなゲームだと思います。
　一番最初にあげた、ゲーム開発途上国、ザ・シムズ、ザ・タワーが好きな経営ゲームマニアにはおすすめします。

32551333.review:
Software Inc.: the land of a hundred thousand UI windows.

I very badly wanted to like this game. I dumped hours into Game Dev Tycoon and regularly play games like Cities: Skylines wishing I could start and manage my own company in game. Then I heard about Software Inc., and immediately plunged into it, expecting a fantastic and detailed sim. And to be clear, that's what Software Inc. is at its core - an extremely detailed sim.

However, it's far too impenetrable in its current state. The developer has succumbed to feature creep and the tutorials for the game are nowhere near as verbose and informative as they need to be relative to how many things you need to manage. Additionally, many of the core game mechanics are hidden behind menus and right-click panels ad infinitum. Some serious thought needs to be dedicated to the game's UI, because a simulation game with a bad UI is the absolute bane of the genre.

I'm certain that somewhere under the tens of windows the first tutorials instruct you to open, Software Inc. is a deep and well-made simulation. But until it becomes far more clear to play - you should NOT have to look up third-party guides to start your first playthrough, contrary to what many on the reviews for this game say - I simply cannot recommend this game to anybody other than the most dedicated and hardcore simulation players. Prison Architect is another game that suffered from this problem early in its development, but recovered from it spectacularly. I certainly hope the developer of this one takes a page or two from that playbook, and I look forward to seeing what comes in future updates.

I expect people to be upset to see a thumbs down on the reviews for this game, but I won't refund this game simply because I genuinely believe in this game's ability to succeed. I'll keep trying to figure it out until something clicks.

值得一玩，不过这类游戏到了后期很容易无聊，所以对模式上仍然需要一些突破和改变。例如之前的youtube直播的游戏，就是直接让玩家更换了场景和协同模式，大大提高了游戏性。
游戏在细节上做的很到位，看评论说数值模糊，但我觉得并非如此。开发者考虑的是真实性，所以数字只能作为参考而不是全面的。如果数据过于细化，反而很假了，所以这方面很难权衡。

32477900.review:
奶牛关评测：https://cowlevel.net/game/Software_Inc/review/2477824

软件公司是一款策略模拟游戏，与mad games tycoon类似但从立项和开发环节相对贴近现实，且在建造上更为丰富，从公司每层的内部规划与建筑结构和布局更为自由。

开发包装+

从游戏、系统、管理工具到引擎等，游戏可供开发多种耗时不一且回报颇丰的项目，与Mad games tycoon不同的是，从立项到发布中间要走四个过程、分别是立项、开发、测试和营销，虽然其背后的关卡设计思路与养成类游戏一样，不过至少在文字描述和界面设计上，玩家还是可以获得从一个项目的诞生到成熟那份喜悦，就像生孩子一样（漫长）。

环境模拟+

游戏中不仅支持自建办公室，还可以设计家具布局，游戏对办公室有着相对真实性的模拟，玩家不能只摆放一个桌子凳子和电脑就开始走向CEO，还需要对建筑的光照、温度和环境舒适有着诸多要求，不仅如此员工还有着吃喝拉撒加薪退休等一系列需求，玩家不仅要负责他们的停车区扩建，还需要承担他们的退休费，因此游戏对公司的管理和运营模式有着相对真实的刻画。

建筑规划+

多数养成模拟游戏都具有自建办公室的功能，但软件公司在这一方面有着更深层的设计，软件公司从办公室层面的设计扩大到了整个建筑的设计，玩家可以使用系统提供的工具构建不同规模的办公楼，可以是标准的写字楼也可以弄成形态新颖的现代化概念楼。

MOD+

玩家可以上传自己制作的本地化MOD，也可以将自己设计的建筑作为蓝图MOD而分享。

尽管游戏在真实性上有着充足的刻画，但在很多环节的体验上做的非常差劲。

数值-

为了凸显真实性，游戏对员工开发的速度、设计水平和营销效果上做的非常模糊，玩家感受不到不同水平员工的效率，更不知道员工之间的合作在何处体现，但游戏中更多的败笔在于其项目开发过程，漫长的开发时期彻底毁了整个游戏的体验，mad games tycoon即使用一个员工去开发一个大项目也不会超过现实时间10分钟，然而软件公司开发的项目却会花费玩家现实时间半小时甚至更久，而软件公司的开发者对于这一过程的解决方式更是让人哭笑不得：用小游戏的方式来打发这部分时间，而这些小游戏却是连连看和打字机，并且小游戏对开发效率没有丝毫帮助。

养成-

尽管游戏有着诸多环境要求使得玩家不得不对建筑进行再规划与家具再升级，但游戏并没有对这方面有着更深一步的扩展，只要玩家在前期建筑规划合适，那么之后的扩建和升级只有美观性的帮助，其次随着发布项目获得的资金越来越多，游戏只提供了收购其他公司的消费方式，并且这种收购也仅限于让竞争者从其他公司消失，游戏在养成方面设计堪称灾难。


这个游戏第一次让我有了给中评的想法，因为游戏在建造上设计的很让我满意，但数值和体验设计上做的实在是差劲。

Currently hav half dozen software titles with titles from audio tools & sequels thru 2d editor and virus protection software.  1) Most important start out with just yourself & tiny office single software project - 2) Until you bank enough cash with contract work U can save up to 60k or more . 3) Then start work on first software release which will prob. take couple months. 4) Choose software release that matchs your talent & biz specialty - example biz specialty if audio tools you should choose audio tools software . 5) Select smaller project that requires the least quality like ' bad ' as opposed to ' good ' fyi  - less quality means less work time for you, and getting your software sold.  6)  Remember before software release while your project is still not finished at the end of  the beta phase - you should hire a marketing talented employee who will boost your sales if you start market campaign before end of ur software projects beta phase. Note:  prior to software release market campaign use radio, newspaper, interwebs, tv etc. 7) Check for software reviews notification and soak up the praise - good review & proper marketing will boost sales for ur software sales. 32379946.review:
An Early Access gem. If the developer continues with it then this game could be the benchmark for software/game development games. I'll go a step further and say with the right polishing & balancing this game could be one of the best business sims ever.

I've logged almost 90 hours in 2 weeks. The game is addictive. Only other game I've ever done that with was Kenshi (another great Steam Early Access game). Most of that time was multiple restarts learning the game.  And idle time reading/watching tutorials. Most of which are very outdated. You will be hard pressed finding current tips/tricks for the newest builds. You're best bet is to just jump in the pool and learn as you go.

The modding community is active somewhat and I think in the future as more things are added to the game the mods will get better and more abundant. 

My only complaint I guess is just how easy the game gets if you are the first to release a type of software. The game literally goes from red bankruptcy warnings to the next day having millions of dollars. You build yourself a closet with room for you and a co-worker. You start programming on fast speed for 6 months. If you finish before your competitor and release your software it becomes a totally different game from the one you started playing. I suppose the game is alot like winning the lottery in real life. You go from hoping to make the rent to buying a real house for your dog overnight.

I can't recommend this game enough. If you like business sims then this is gonna be a homerun for you. Even if you don't play those types of games I'd give it a try. This is a game that seems to be done right. I can't wait to see what it turns in to.

It's just half baked...

32362444.review:
Неплохая игра в жанре Tycoon, где вам предстоит управлять компанией по разработке ПО, попутно, на купленном участке, в лучших традициях The Sims, отстраивая свой офис. Не пожалел что купил, но надеюсь на доработки и развитие проекта.

[u]Основной геймплей[/u]:
Основной гейплей - крутится вокруг очень интересного микроменеджмента в компании, занимающейся разработкой программного обеспечения. Хочу отметить, что в отличие от "коллег по жанру", Software Inc. позволяет разрабатывать не только игры и игровые движки, но и "более серьезное"  ПО - операционные системы, офисные пакеты, антивирусы и т. д.  А это значит, что игра позволяет создать целую империю, подсадив добрую половину человечества, включая конкурентов, на свою ОС и эксклюзивные продукты для нее, а это весьма круто.

Каждый сотрудник компании, как в The Sims хочет есть, пить, развлекаться и общаться. Все эти нужды нужно учитывать, если не хочешь, чтобы ценный сотрудник уволился. 

  Кроме того, можно выделить часть финансов компании в страховую сумму из которой будут производится страховые и пенсионные отчисления сотрудникам. Наверное разработчики хотели таким образом  влиять на привлекательность вашей фирмы в качестве работодателя, чтобы к вам стремились лучшие специалисты, но я обнаружил эту возможность лишь в середине игры и создание страхового фонда ни на что ощутимо не повлияло.


[u]Дополнительные элементы геймплея[/u]:
Здесь у меня сложилось впечатление, что разработчики пихали все ассеты в Unity, которые нашли по дешевке.
Такие элементы игры как строительство и детальное создание персонажа, на мой взгляд, были добавлены только потому, что уже были прикручены к используемому движку и не требовали от разработчиков значительных усилий. На мой взгляд они избыточны, перегружают геймплей и совершенно не вписываются в сеттинг: у меня тут софтверная компания, а я занимаюсь возведением стен и расстановкой сортиров - серьезно?! Для такой игры вполне достаточно покупки дополнительных помещений как в Theme Hospital и Big Pharma.
Мини игру при разработке вполне можно выпилить - она ни к чему.

[u]Сложность и баланс[/u]:
Игра несбалансирована. 
На начальных этапах она кажется сложной из-за необходимости разбираться в интерфейсе и укладываться в скудный бюджет (последнее несложно, благодаря возможности брать дешевые кредиты). Но потом с первого же успешного продукта вы получаете столько денег, что они перестают иметь значение и интерес к этой составляющей игры теряется. 

[u]Технологии и возможности[/u]:
Технологий очень много, но в большинстве своем они появляются просто потому, что пришло время им появится. Дерево технологий, доступных для непосредственного изучения очень бедно, надеюсь разработчики его расширят - станет намного интереснее.
Очень не хватает возможности разработки поисковиков и социальных сетей. 
Обозначенная возможность онлайн дистрибьюции не вызывает желания бороться за долю рынка, потому что программы неплохо распространяются и конкурирующими сервисами за дополнительную плату, а как я уже писал выше - деньги быстро перестают иметь значение.

Управление серверными решениями можно было расширить. Серверную архитектуру можно масштабировать, подключать дополнительные серверы,  но как расширять пропускную спопобность канала связи я так и не понял. 

[u]Графика:[/u]
Графика примитивная и в целом приятная. Пользовательский интерфейс местами перегружен.

Обучение в игре есть, но подано не в виде контекстных подсказок по ходу игры, а в виде "Стой! Прочти вот эту кучу текста и потом будешь играть дальше". Это меня сразу выбесило - отключил к дьяволу подсказки и разбирался сам.

Все вышеперечисленное безусловно является детскими болезнями и результатом работы малой группой. Я сам разработчик и хорошо понимаю, что авторы проделали титаническую работу, чтобы довести продукт до релиза. 

Надеюсь в ближайшее время все шероховатости будут устранены. 

Плюсы:
 - Интереснейший основной геймплей с уникальными элементами
 - Приятная графика
 - Цена

Минусы
 - Лишние элементы геймплея
 - Отсутствие русификации
 - Недружелюбное обучение
 - Местами перегруженный UI

32334221.review:
Amazing. The dev told someone in discussion the other day that this game is possibly still 2 years from "v1.0"... And it's likely one of the most thorough, elegant and fun sim/management experiences I've played to date. This 1-man-show is a talented s.o.b. and this game worth the price (even in Alpha).

11/10

EDIT: I opted into the beta test pretty quickly to get my hands on new features (highly recommended). I ran into my first major bug/crash the other day (about 40 hours logged) when I hit undo to delete a section of a room and, suddenly, all of my walls disappeared from the rest of the room. A bit of flailing and one more hopeful "undo" and, boom, kaput. What do I see in the next update patch? "Fix for the bug where walls disappear...". This guy is on it. Good times.

One gripe I will give is an echo of what I see from the few thumbs down comments I've looked at, and that's the lack of feedback as you're going along. I've done a lot of exterior research and googling to get around the lack of tutorials or in-game help. While it hasn't hampered my experience, I can certainly appreciate why it would irk some people. This thing really leaves you to your own devices, which, come to think of it, is kind of like real life (no "progress" bars telling you when your job is done) but can be cumbersome when you waste a bunch of time going down a certain path only to lose ambition and/or hit a wall and go bankrupt. A bit more feedback/tutorials on different ways to develop a strategy would be helpful, but I have to imagine that is a ways down the road (still early alpha). Even with this small gripe, this is still a great game/experience.

32315804.review:
This game reminds me of Game Dev Tycoon on steroids! Not only can you make software there are tons of other things you do and it feels a lot close to actually running a company. Making good software is the core of this game and has other things like Stocks, Team Management, Research, Distribution channels, servers and ofcourse the fact that you can build everything from scratch. 

This is the most detailed review I will ever give for a game I suppose because I have been looking for such a game for ages and I want it to be the best!

[b]Pros[/b]-
[list]
[*]It is very very realistic .Examples- A perfectly good product will fail if you launch it after a bigger similar software is launched. If you fail to deliver on a contract, you lose credibility and you get lesser deals and lesser talents for hiring. You deliver contracts before time, your credibility increases. Over work your employees and you get bad products. Dont release a sequel to a successful product and you start losing fans. Every action you take will have a direct affect on a lot of things which is similar to what you would expect in real life.

[*]It's not just about the software, there are a lot of other things you indulge in. You can research technologies and receive royalties. You can buy stocks of other companies and if you think any product will suit you, you can Trade IP or just buy out the company. You can make different teams and assign different works to them I had one support team to take up deals and support products, two core dev teams and one Marketing teams. You can take up hosting in your servers for other companies. There is insurance, pensions after retirement and loans.

[*]You get a lot of information before you make a decision. You can see how other companies are faring and see their detailed charts like a public company should. You can see all the software released ever and all that will be released in the near future. You can see details of every employee like how are they fitting in the team, what is decreasing their productivity etc.  

[*]A really detailed and easy building (Remins me of Sims). Things like selecting all the furniture in a room and modifying them, copy a whole desk setup etc are really helpful. Building management seems very real as well. You can assign rooms to teams or to roles, restrict room usage, decorate rooms etc. You have to maintain the correct temperature and proper lighting. It's almost as good as the Sims(That's a huge compliment) but with lesser items and graphics

[*]You can play it for hours without getting bored. The first time i played, I played 13 hours at a stretch!

[*]The graphics is appealing, not realistic ofcourse, but good to look at!

[*]MODS! I can see that once the game becomes popular and we have community modders, building wise, it will be The Sims. 

[*]No Bugs as such even though it is in Alpha. I mean I did not get any weird behavior or glitches like sofware failing for no reasons or workers not working for no valid reasons or not even graphics glitches. That's pretty big for a game still in Alpha!

[*]The Multi-Window feature. You can keep multiple windows open and drag them around like Windows. It's very helpful when you want two information at the same time. Like if you are deciding which company share to buy, open "All Companies" window and then open "Upcoming softwares" window at the same time to make better decisions. It would have been very irritating (I am looking at you Sims!) if i had to close one and opne next because there is just a lot of infomation to keep track of! 
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]-


[list]
[*]It's very exciting and nail biting when you are starting out and short in money but all you need is one big success and then it becomes a cake walk. You just cannot lose after that. I launched one 2D editor which gave me 250 million dollars and then launched a Operating system which gave me 6 Billion dollars and I could actually buy out all the other companies! The problem is the software building costs. it will at most take you just 10 million dollars to make the top end software and you will lose atmost 5 million, thats nothing. Once you get big, software building costs should go up into hundreds of millions and you should lose a lot of money if the product fails.

[*]The stocks system makes it very very easy. Once you have earned a couple of millions, all you have to do is buy out stocks of newly launched companies. 5 stocks will cost you 300000 dollars and they will return you atleast 50 million dollars. If they dont all you lose is the initial amount which is nothing! I once bought a 5 company shares worth 50000 each and each evaluated at 89 million dollars later. It can happen with one company once, not all of them. 
There is a lot of things the dev can do- Bring concept of IPO, you cannot just buy companies as they come. It is upto the companies to decide that. Bring dilution that happens in real life. Just beacuse i bought 25% in 50000 doesnt mean it wiull remain 25% all the game. To maintain shares you have to keep on investing. That way you have higher chances of losing money, and that is what is exciting. It shouldn't be so damn easy to make 100 million dollars from 50000.  


[*]No other company ever has reached a a billion dollar evaluation. Just like there is competition when you are starting out, there should be when you are successful. It's not exciting if there is no competition and you know you can buy out all the other companies. 

[*]The interactions between companies are non existent. I want other companies to buy my shares, offer me to buy my IP, threaten me with lawsuits, publicly say bad things about me to affect my credibility, Attempt to take over my company. I should be on the toes while making any decisions!

[*]Project automation is not good. The first thing a team of 7 did on automation is build an OS. I think automation should be for taking up contracts or deals so that they can be independent but not stupid.

[*]There is some optimization problems with lighting. at night whrn lights are on and esp in building more, the fps drops down to 8-10. Change the time of the day and then again it's smoothb as butter. I don't have a beast of a laptop (i5 6th Gen, 8GB RAM, GTX940M) but this seems more like a optimization issue rather than system requirements.
[/list]

[b]Suggestions[/b]
[list]
[*]Just because I took over a company, doesnt mean I want full controls. They can be independent companies owned wholly 
by me which i can invest in to make it bigger or sale it later. That's More realistic. Also I should be able to create a subsidary company which will only make games, which again will be independent. The bigger you grow, you would want to branch out.

[*]There should be a way to do illegal stuff. Real life companies does it all the times. There is a risk of finding out and you can be sued for that by other companies or prosecutors. You can settle or fight in court. Also there should be prosecution by other rival companies even though you did not do anything illegal! It sounds exciting. Corporate espionage to find out important crucial data like what features the upcoming software has or to steal data sounds good too.

[*]Employee poaching would be fun too. Employees don't leave the company now! What's the fun in that? It will be more exciting if the employees have a project value to them . If a programmer has built an OS and is then poached by a rival company, they will make a better OS from his experience and I would take time to find a equally good replacement. I should be able to poach employees of rivals as well who comes with value.

[*]Some building items like lights, fans and exhaust dont need human interaction. So I should be able to place an exhaust on the wall which has a table in front of it, or a light anywhere.
[/list]

Before I start... 

[list]
[*] Don't hesitate. If you love management games, get it. No exceptions. 
[*] This. Is. The. Most. Fun. Game. Ever. 
[/list]

Alright. So... this is my playthrough footage, and yes, I know I'm new. 

[h1] Personal Playthrough Log [/h1]

[olist]
[*]I start a company, X Generation, and start a humble office
[*]I hire other people and try to take on complex software of my own too early
[*]I narrowly dodge bankruptcy
[*]I get a motherload of money suddenly from a big contract, only to blow it on a server room and new building
[*]I, once again, expand WAY too fast and am literally a few bucks away from being bankrupt
[*]Knowing I won't make it for another paycheck date, i fire all my employees thinking it'll be okay
[*]I forget the game is realistic, and I go bankrupt from my power and water bills from my new enormous structure
[*]Ragequit. 
[*]I start a new company much more skilled called LuxTech
[*]I build a nice little place and get rich off of contracts... myself
[*]I install mods and put a neon sign saying my company's name on the front of the office to make me feel good
[*]I wonder how the heck I print physical software, and look up YouTube how-tos, hoping it's accurate
[*]I haven't played any more yet. 
[/olist]

[h1] Overall... [/h1]

It usually takes time to learn the basics. It can be slow at first, but once you get your first hit it instantly becomes so much more fun. Get this. It's an absolute masterpiece.

[b]  11/10 Amazing [/b]

31799282.review: This game isn't the worst game I've played on Steam, and the depth and detail are really admirable. In fact, for an alpha release this is probably one of the more stable games I've played. However, the learning curve for this game is huge. The UI is... terrible. It's so convoluted, and the fact that you have a tutorial for each tab on the pannel is just overwhelming and bogs down gameplay. I thought maybe I was just not smart enough to figure it out, so I showed it to two friends of mine--one of whom makes games, one of whom is a UI developer, both of whom are computer engineers--and both of them had responses that pretty much boiled down to "what the fuck". I was even asked if this was some sort of Eve online ripoff. Yeah, it's just way too much to be fun at the moment, and while I have hopes for the future, I know that computer engineers are also really averse to good UI if their product sticks. So, I implore you Coredumping: Invest in some scale-back. Clean your UI a little and make it something that's not as much of a time investment to get into.

31593221.review:
[i]Software Inc[/i] reminds me of The Sims, except that instead of building a house and managing your characters' home lives, you're building an office and managing their work. It's an interesting idea, and the game has a lot of charm to it with its low-poly pastel graphics. Unfortunately, I can't recommend the game because I just didn't find it fun. Outside of the building aspect, most of the actual "gameplay" is just clicking around in menus to assign employees to teams, prioritize projects, load-balance servers, etc.

Perhaps the issue for me is that I'm a software developer in real life, so the game reminded me too much of actual work, but I kind of felt like I was "playing" an Excel spreadsheet. There are many different systems to learn and manage, to the point that it's a bit overwhelming, but no matter how well you play the game your impact seems to be limited to making numbers and bar graphs go up or down.

I almost feel bad writing a negative review, because clearly the developer has put in a lot of effort and paid great attention to detail in designing the game's many systems. But personally, I would have preferred fewer but more engaging game mechanics. I wouldn't call [i]Software Inc[/i] a bad game; as other reviews show, if you're the type of person this particular style of game appeals to, then it's very well made and you'll probably enjoy it. I thought I was that kind of person, but I guess not--at least not to the extent required by this game.

Also ich finds echt klasse. Ist echt ne gelungene Mischung aus Sims und allem aus dem Genre von Game-Dev-Story. Man kann echt viel machen, hier mal ein kurzer Auszug:
- HR beauftragen Kandidaten zu finden. Man selber muss dann jemanden auswählen der am besten auch zum Team passt (Skill-mäßig und auch persönlich)
- Patente entwickeln (andere Firmen versuchen die gleichen aber auch zu bekommen, sodass das immer einen Character von Wettrennen hat)
- Aktien-markt. Man kann mit Aktien handeln, Dividente kassieren und andere Firmen übernehmen (dadurch erhält man deren Patente + Produkte).
- Serverfarmen bauen: darüber laufen dann so Sachen wie SCM, Backend für die Software die man entwickelt oder stellt einen Distribution Channel für seine + Fremdsoftware
- ProjectManagement. Hab ich noch nicht ausprobiert, aber damit kann man wohl Folgeversionen von bestimmter Software automatisieren. 
- Marketing
- Rezeption um Deals mit anderen Firmen zu bekommen.

.... also für ein EarlyAccess kann es schon verdammt viel und läuft echt Stabil. Bietet jetzt schon mehr als jeder Vollpreis-Titel in der Sparte.

This is an awesome game. Even though it's in an alpha state Software Inc. has more content then most games of this genre, and more to come. As of right now (4/22/17) the game is a little unbalanced, there are a few ways to amass a fortune early on, also the expenses are a bit unbalanced, as in everything is pretty cheap, but you can avoid these as they are not mandatory to succeed. The developer has stated he will be balancing the game later on. Many people will say once you make your first million the game becomes too easy, but I find that a problem only on the easier difficulties. As on my first hard playthrough I managed to go bankrupt after my first successful release. I absolutely love the reputation system is this game. I really like the idea of building up a reputation in a certain field, and when you venture out into other fields you again have to build up a reputation, although a popular company will still sell well regardless but better if you have a higher reputation in that field. 

All in all this is a great game, made by a single developer, that in my opinion is better then most titles in this genre made by already established developers, and is only getting better.

31164624.review:
Wer sich schon immer mal ein Unternehmen á la Software-Riesen wie Microsoft, Facebook, Google etc. aufbauen wollte, bekommt mit Software Inc. eine spaßige und fordernde Möglichkeit dazu. 

Software Inc. unterscheidet sich meiner Meinung nach sehr stark von Genre-Vertretern wie Game Dev Tycoon, Mad Games Tycoon, Game Corp etc. 
Hier hat man nicht nur die Möglichkeit Spiele zu produzieren, sondern gar sein eigenes Betriebssystem, Office-Programme, Audio-Programme, Engines etc. zu entwickeln
Wie der Name eben schon sagt, beschränkt man sich hier nicht nur auf die Entwicklung von Spaß & Spiel, sondern geht es in erster Linie um Computer-Software im Allgemeinen.

Was dieses Spiel besonders von seinen Kontrahenten unterscheidet ist zu einem die tiefergreifendere Wirtschafts-/Finanz-Simulation und der Ausbau bzw. Erbau seiner eigenen Geschäftsstelle. 

So ist es zum Beispiel möglich Aktienhandel zu betreiben, in diesem man viel gewinnen, aber auch viel verlieren kann. Meinen ersten Spielstand hätte ich somit schon fast gegen die Wand gefahren, da ich in die falschen Companys investierte, die letztlich Pleite gingen. 
Dazu kann man sich noch genaue Statistiken der Kontrahenten anzeigen lassen; Beispielsweise die Produkte die entwickelt wurden, wie hoch die Gehaltszahlungen, Dividenden, Absätze, allgemeine Ausgaben, Aktien-Investitionen usw. über die letzten Monate & Jahre waren.

Besonders cool finde ich, dass es eine Möglichkeit gibt, die jeweiligen Veröffentlichungs-Termine der Konkurrenz einzusehen (Sofern diese Bekannt gegeben wurden). So entsteht eine Art Konkurrenz-Kampf und erfordert Planungsgeschick. Entwickelt man beispielsweise gerade eine Game-Engine, deren Entwicklung einige Monate/Jahre in Anspruch nehmen kann, und man sieht, dass zu dem geplanten Wunsch-Release-Zeitraum, von Konkurrent A ebenfalls eine Game-Engine veröffentlicht wird, muss man abschätzen ob es sich z.B. lohnen würde die eigene Software ein oder zwei Monate früher zu releasen. Was auf der anderen Seite wiederum mit Zeitdruck verbunden ist um ein optimales Ergebnis zu erzielen. 
Denn gerade am Anfang ist das Risiko des Scheiterns groß. Vor allem wenn der Konkurrent ein paar (Hundert-)Millionen Dollar/Euro, oder Fans, mehr auf dem Konto hat.
Oder aber man verzichtet auf den direkten Konkurrenz-Kampf und nimmt sich lieber einige, kostenintensive, Monate mehr, um den Release später zu vollziehen. 


Die andere große, wenn nicht sogar die größte Stärke, ist der Bau/Ausbau der eigenen Geschäftsstelle. Es gleicht wirklich einer Art Sims-Aufbau Spiel. 
Man hat praktisch völlige Freiheit wie man sein Gebäude gestalten & dekorieren will. Später, mit dem nötigen Geld, sind sogar wahre & luxuriöse Gebäude-Komplexe möglich, die vom Server-Raum im Keller, bis hin zum Meeting-Raum in der obersten Chef-Etage reichen. 

Ebenfalls gilt es die richtigen Mitarbeiter einzustellen, auszubilden etc. 
In diesem Sinne ist es auch wichtig die Angestellten bei Laune zu halten. Eventuell mit einer Kantine, Ruhe-Raum, Wasser-Spender, schön dekorierten Räumen, oder kurzen Arbeitszeiten uvm. Ja, man kann sogar die Arbeits- sowie Urlaubszeiten festlegen!


Letzten Endes möchte ich auch keine weiteren großen Worte darüber verlieren. Hier ist auf jeden Fall das Potenzial da, eine nette, spaßige & fordernde Manager-/Wirtschafts-Simulation zu werden, was man im momentanen Stadium wirklich sehr gut zeigt und sich auch von anderen Genre-Vertretern schon deutlich abhebt. 
Man sollte sich auch nicht vom Grafik-Stil abschrecken lassen. Er ist wirklich besser als man denkt und passt sehr gut ins Konzept. 

Wer Aufbau- sowie Manager & Wirtschafts-Simulationen attraktiv findet, und auch Spiele wie Game Dev, oder Mad Games Tycoon spielt bzw. gespielt hat, kann um Software Inc. eigentlich nicht herum kommen. Vor allem bei diesem Preis nicht!

Man sollte sich auch nicht von der englischen Sprache abschrecken lassen! Es gibt im Workshop auch gewisse Deutsch-Mods die einen großen Teil übersetzen. Wenn auch nicht Alles, da einige Sätze wohl fest im Spiel verankert und nicht änderbar sind.

Von mir gibt es daher eine klare Kaufempfehlung! Da man für 14€ wirklich einige Stunden in diesen Titel versenken kann.

30788975.review:
カイロソフトのゲーム発展途上国とRimWorldを足して二で割ったようなゲーム。
クオリティの高い日本語化MODあり。経営シミュが好きな人は絶対にやってみるべき。

ウサギ小屋を建て、下請け仕事をいくつかこなし、金が貯まったら休憩室や冷暖房を備えたオフィスを建て社員を雇い、自社でソフトウェアを開発・販売、金が貯まればオフィスを拡張し社員を雇い、また新たなソフトを……というのがこのゲームの主な流れ。
しかし、経営シミュにありがちな軌道に乗った後の退屈なルーチンワークにはならず、チームの人数が増えれば増えるほど作業速度は上がりにくくなり、製品のバグは増えていくため、社員一人あたりの生産性を上げてやる必要が出てくる。娯楽、部屋環境、人間関係、といった欲求を満たし開発環境を整えてやれば社員たちの意欲はみなぎり、驚くほどの作業効率を発揮する。逆に欲求が満たされなければ作業効率は下がり、最後には仕事を辞めて出て行ってしまう。ブラック企業はこの世界では成立しないのだ。
また、今後のアップデートでハッカーの存在や海賊版とそれに対抗するDRMといった動的要素が追加される予定で、よりダイナミックで作業感の少ないゲームになるはずだ。

やたらと自由度の高い建築ツールはSimsを思い出す。作った設計図はworkshopに投稿して共有できる。

社員の欲求、チーム管理、マーケティング、研究、株取引、と情報量が非常に多いのでとっつき難く見えるかもしれないが、とても丁寧なチュートリアルが順番に説明してくれるので、こういったシミュが初めてでも迷うことは少ないだろう。

Крутая игруха, можно выбрать различные направления своей деятельности.
Ты можешь разрабатывать ОС, офисные программы, CMS, а если скачать моды, то и собрать свой компьютер и разработать комплектующие к нему.

Зарабатывай на социальных сетях (в моей последней игре, меня она разорила, так как был большой трафик и маленькая маржа)

Выпуская игры, веб-браузеры и т.п.

Настаривай свой офис как хочешь, если с дизайном плохо, просто возьми из воркшопа уже сделанную модель.

Можно также выбрать путь работы по контрактам, предоставлению хостинга и дистрибуции, поддержки ПО и игр. 

Каждая новая игра может закончиться совсем по-разному! Когда наш офис мал мы занимаемся микроменеджментом, но когда у нас в подчинении уже 50-100 человек и больше, на помощь приходят руководители и управление проектами. 

Есть куда расти данному продукту, например, воздействие окружающего мира, инфляция, и т.п. вещи. Но уже сейчас это то, во что можно залипнуть надолго!

30420429.review:
You might say, "Why would you play for twenty hours and not recommend this game?"  Well, while Software Inc can draw you in, it's a hollow experience.  I've played my share of time sinks like Minecraft, Factorio, and Fantasy Life.  These types of 'just play' games can be absolutely absorbing as you build, design and or grow.  With Software Inc. however, I have to be honest: I've never felt like I accomplished anything or even something I was happy about.  Your software is just a name among other pieces of software.  You never feel like you contributed to a changing market, or cornered your own slice of it.  Your software isn't special or unique, or even interesting.  Neither are your company or employees.  Factorio has no point, but I can examine my ridiculous supply chains and product lines knowing I built all of it and it's full of my own dumb solutions and compromises.  Software Inc just doesn't have ... satisfaction.

If I sat down and really chewed through it I could probably identify exactly why I don't like this game, but it really doesn't matter when the end result is my first point: when I'm done playing, I literally feel like I've wasted my time.  And for someone who put as many hours into games as I do, right now I just cannot recommend it.
30420429.developer_response:
Judging from the rating of this review, this seems to be a popular opinion and I believe the criticism is very valid.

I want to address it, because I think your criticism doesn’t acknowledge the building aspects of the game.

Software design is currently very hollow in Software Inc. and I hope to improve on that in the future. However, I don’t think it’ll ever get to a point where every piece of software you release will feel completely unique, as this was never the point. Software Inc. is a business management simulation and I can’t think of many management focused games that achieves that sense of accomplishment you get from Factorio or Minecraft, as the focus is more on strategy, planning and gaining virtual money, rather than perceivable creativeness. 

Nonetheless, I think Software Inc. adds that sense of accomplishment through the building mechanics. The management aspect of the game is supposed to feed into the building aspect, where you can get creative and build something unique, while working around the constraints of the system, like noise, temperature, environment, space optimization and minimizing walking distance. This part of the game suffers greatly from the fact, that once you make a successful product in Software Inc. there is no challenge, everything is just handed to you on a silver platter. I’ll be aiming to balance construction costs in alpha 10, to make expanding your building and adding new wings more satisfying. I think adding the ability to rent office space at low cost will make building your own office that much more satisfying.

I have taken you criticism into consideration and I do believe a lot could be done to make the development process feel more personal and in-depth. If you have any ideas to make the market feel more responsive I would like to hear it. The market is currently completely dynamic and responds to everything you release, I don’t know if that comes across very clearly while playing, though.

30405826.review:
Software Inc. 是一款非常有深度的軟件開經營模擬遊戲，很多細節都引人入勝，例如開發技術多元化、市場模擬真實、後續技術支持等等，全部都令人十分有代入感，像真的有經營軟件公司一樣，讓我玩得停不下來！但這個遊戲仍有開發過程，還是有一點小問題題，而當中的遊戲教學更是不堪入目，大部分都要自行摸索，要較多時間熟習整個系統。

優點：
- 逼真的經營模擬，完美呈現整個開發循環
- 軟件開發的技術多元化，加上Steam Workshop的mods，細節非常豐富
- 前後期營銷及後續技術支援系統令玩家完整地體驗軟件公司經營模式
- 公司大樓可任意建築
- 僱員的性格及資料詳盡，不只是普通低智的NPC
- 員工之間的性格及配合度對開發效率有顯著影響
- 各種環境因素對模擬經營的影響十分仔細，如溫度、噪音、光線、衛生環境等
- 整體市場模擬良好，沒有名聲的小公司經營困難、OS市場難以打入等都非常真實
- 可接受短期合約、中長期交易等項目，不只限於自行開發軟件
- Software Inc. 的更新較為頻密

缺點：
(大問題)
- 遊戲教學的簡陋與整個遊戲的複雜程度完全不成正比
(軟件印刷沒教學，害我要慢慢爬文看他們的更新歷史才弄清楚)

(小問題)
- 軟件評測(Review)系統不能選擇評測數量，一旦快進就被扣大量金錢買評測
- 某些員工的壓力不知為何上升得很快，效率非常低
- 有員工肚餓不懂找東西吃 (只試過一次)
- Alpha 8可選多個網上發行渠道，但Alpha 9只能自己發行？
- 遊戲銷量有時反差很大，如一開始賣不出，但一年後銷量突然暴漲(這是正常？) ；或一開始銷量選好，但半年後突然跌至零
(建議：如果銷量是因其他公司的發佈影響，可否有訊息提醒玩家？)
- Alpha 8時自己的公司股票不能回購 (未試Alpha 9)
- 只有部分物件或詞彙在滑鼠放上去時出現解釋 (例如關發軟件的的技術選項)
- 伺服器負荷過重前應提示玩家，而非伺服器爆滿後
……
還有很多小問題要開發組處理，期待日後的更新

30362791.review:
[h1]Il primo manageriale che vi sorprenderà veramente[/h1]

Infatti, la quantità dei dettagli posti in questo indie è superlativa e vi stupirà già al primo colpo.

Il gameplay introduce comunque un concetto già visto in passato: gestire una startup, guarda caso, di software.
Ma non è il classico gioco, più dipendenti ho e più produco, infatti vi sono moltissime caratteristiche da tenere in condizione, le quali sono determinate da altri fattori, anche quelli da tenere in considerazione.
Per esempio, come da controparte reale, i dipendenti in ufficio che lavorano in squadre (sviluppo, marketing, risorse,...) devono disporre di un approccio sociale con i colleghii, non solo per migliorare l'aria tra di essi e renderli felici ma anche di velocizzare il lavoro.
Inoltre le caratteristiche degli uffici sono infinite, infatti sarà il giocatore a costruirli tenendo in considerazione tutti gli elementi della progettazione abitativa.
Es. L'illuminazione solare non è sempre della stessa intensità e nella stessa posizione, il giocatore mentre progetta dovrà quindi tenere conto degli aspetti relativi alla superficie finestrata di progetto, perché se dispone in una stanza una finestra enorme potra sì avere tutta la luce che gli serve per risparmiare energia, ma ciò comporterà ad un aumento notevole della temperatura della stanza.
Un altro esempio di elemento di progettazione è il suono, studiato molto bene a mio parere con la 9.4, che passerà nel modo come noi lo conosciamo, attraverso le porte, finestre, muri,...

Poi passando alla parte del lavoro possiamo fare soldi in tanti modi, software, videogiochi, hosting,... Fatto sta che ogni software prodotto potrà rispondere a determinate caratteristiche, che determineranno il tempo di sviluppo e quindi il costo d'investimento. Poi ci sono le questioni legate ai fan, marketing,... bla bla bla.
Dovrei continuare ma sarebbe troppo lungo.
Insomma, compratelo!

30112137.review:
This review is actually short (the second part of the review is mainly for the devs)

In it's current state, this game is extremely playable. It's designed very well, both graphically and technically.

I have so much fun playing it. My Software business feels alive. Most simulation games like the populare game dev simulators out there don't offer this "feeling". Other games feel very robotic, but Software Inc. has a nicely structured and well developed AI that feels less like an AI and more like a living software company.

Hopefully the modding community continure to release new assets like new furniture and other nice stuff. 3rd party furniture is a huge part of the game if you're into the designing aspect of Software Inc.

FInal verdict - Early Access 10/10!

_____________________

FOR THE DEVS:

This game would improve by offering more granularity to the statistics that are viewable to the player and maybe a calculator that is part of the interface. (e.g. I have an outsourced support team that only does Support Deals. Currently, I can only see the total income from all Deals, but I would like the option to divide this further by deal type... support, marketting, hosting, etc. This will help manage the efficiency of my offices.)

I also find it hard to manage people I send out on Education or I miss notifications that tell me when people retire. it would be nice to have separate sound effects for different types of notifications (with the option to enable and disable certain notification sounds in the options). It's nice that you have some color coding in the notification corner, but I play this game very fast (most of the time I'm on speed 3) and I have my eyes on different parts of the screen. It would be nice to rely on audio for my notifications.

Also when people retire I'd like to be able to see info about them so I know what role needs to be hired to fill the vacant position.

Another small detail that may be important to new players, whenever the next year starts and there are new things to research, there should be a sound effect and the research icon should glow or at least change color.

Lastly when the annual pay raise window pops up, I'd like more information about each person to help me with the decision of firing them or giving them the raise. :)



These are just some ideas that would benefit my playing style (less automation and more hectic manual management of the business), as I'm sure other people play the way I do. Great job on the game, it's a pleasure to play.

This game is one of the best simulation tycoons in my book.

I have played this game since its early days and for over 400 hours on my little brother's account. Since I find it worthy of my money, I deciced to buy this game to support the developer.

Although this game is really good, it does have some minor problems. (It's still in Early Access you know)

Positives:
- There's a stock market system
- You can do contracts
- You can create & manage multiple teams, similar to that of a real medium-sized company.
- Competition among AI companies is kinda realistic and dynamic
- Mod support
- Great developer, listens to its users opinions
- The game gets much better every alpha release

Negatives:
- Even with the tutorial, I do feel like it has a steep learning curve for some
- Personally, I think the GUI could be improved
- You still cannot make deals to other companies yet
- Too easy, in a way that there are no indirect threats like hacking, disasters, malware, blackmail to disrupt your company
- Employees going for vacation at the same time, unless they're in a different team. (It's like school)
- Many minor bugs not worth mentioning

- Read some more guides / how to, start over.

Cons:

Bottom Line:

As I proficient (and somewhat popular) mod developer for this game - I thought I would review it.

29973894.review:
I can't say I enjoyed my time with this game. It's confusing, and everything you make starting out will be horrible quality. You and your employees will randomly sit there doing nothing, even when you have a contract to complete, or software to develop. I have no idea why they're doing this, and the game doesn't clearly tell you why. There's no clear way to increase your skills. Unlike other, similar games (from Game Dev Tycoon to even Game Dev Story) where you'll naturally become more skilled from projects you complete, you seem to stick on your poor skill level with Software, Inc. Overall, the game is obtuse with how you become better. It feels like in many ways the game strives for realism, but goes past the point where it should've stopped. Your software won't sell, you won't make any profit, and it just creates a frustrating and confusing enviroment. Even with tutorials out the wazoo (pretty much everything you click pops up with a tutorial), the game doesn't give you a clear path to success. I don't ask for the game to hold my hand, but just give me clear paths and steps I can take to get towards some amout of "success". I don't want to be forced to put a ton of hours into a game just to get remotely good. Other, similar games didn't ask this of me. They showed me that with every project my in-game skills would grow and improve, leading to better projects, more money, and a clear (though not always easy) path to success.

I was really interested and curious about this game, but my expectations were no where near met, which saddens me greatly. I wanted to like this game so much. The videos I've seen of it make it seem so fun. But, in practice, I'm left dissapointed, especially someone who's budget doesn't allow him to constantly buy games. 

Maybe one day the game will be good, or at least good to me (my opinion in very much in the minority here). After all, this game is still in Alpha. I hope to give it another try, one day. As for now, I'm afraid to say the game is simply a dissapointment to me.

29971427.review:

Thank you for reading this, and have a nice day.

29770362.review:
Esta análise foi escrita dia 07/02/2017, no momento estamos recebendo a fase de testes do Alpha9.
[b]Recomendo(e muito)[/b], porém já deixo avisado que é um jogo simples mas muito complexo, pois bem, explicarei melhor na resenha que segue abaixo:

Este jogo conta com um enorme potencial de evolução, o qual já se mostrou que se mantém sempre firme devido ao trabalho com amor, dedicação e seriedade que é empenhado pelos devs do jogo, para atentar quem não sabe do que o jogo se trata, escreverei logo abaixo uma síntese de como o jogo funciona, alguns dos seus mecanismos e o por que isso é tão atraente.

A moral do jogo é muito simples, você vai criar uma agência de tecnologia(desenvolvimento de software[ou até de hardware, tem mods pra isso já]). Recomendo firmemente que todos começem a jogar na década de 80, perceber a evolução do meio de tecnologia é fantástico, ver então surgirem os ramos de telefonia móvel, tecnologia 3d e também perceber a evolução das capacidades das máquinas ao longo dos tempos.
Para dar uma noção de como funciona seria interessante criar aqui uma analogia com o TheSims, só que focado no mercado de tecnologia, desenvolver softwares, adquirir uma massa de fans para a sua empresa e até mesmo comprar ou vender ações das outras companhias(AI) presentes no jogo.

Para conseguir dinheiro há muitas formas, a mais comum no começo do jogo é pegar trabalhos por fora para outras empresas, por exemplo, criar um site, criar a arte para algum jogo, desenvolver algumas linhas de comando para o setor do comércio, em fim, tarefas que se forem concluídas com êxito lhe darão maior crédito no mercado o que por sua vez faz com que mais empresas lhe procurem.

Você também pode com o tempo contratar uma recepcionista, esta vai receber executivos de outras empresas que desejam terceirizar o seu serviço, como por exemplo, dar suporte para determinado programa, fazer marketing de algum produto, desenvolver a programação de algum software, hospedar as vendas e download de produtos de terceiros(sim, você pode criar servidores e "alugar" o espaço para os concorrentes), e agora, com a nova update(9) também pode imprimir e enviar as cópias físicas de produtos de outras empresas, mas vale lembrar que isso só funcionará bem a partir do momento que você já tenha alguma reputação.
E é claro, você também pode desenvolver seus próprios softwares, os quais vou listas as possibilidades abaixo:
Sistema Operacional(para computadores,console ou celular), Antivirus, Office, Web Publisher, Editor 2D(diga-se programas estilo photoshop), editor 3d, editor de áudio,Jogos(FPS, RPG, Simulador, Futebol,...) entre outros(não lembro agora, mas tem ainda mais uns 10 ou 15 tipos de softwares).

Cada software vai lhê mostrar uma janela com diversas opções de recursos a serem inclusos ou não, como por exemplo um SistemaOperacional para celulares, vai ter touchscreen?display?áudio?acesso a internet? tudo isso pode ser selecionado para diferenciar o seu produto(lembrando que alguams opções são liberadas com o tempo, afinal os celular não surgiram já com acessoa  internet, não é?)
Bom, para desenvovler qualquer uma dessas paradas você vai precisar montar uma equipe, ou até mesmo trabalhar sozinho(o que vai fazer demorar muito mais), onde quero chegar é na questão de "Skills", ou seja, habilidades. Todos os personagens do jogo vão ter seu próprio painel de skills, as quais irão aumentar trabalhando na área ou então através de cursos(você pode pagar para capacitar seus colaboradores). As habilidades são divididas em Sistema, 2D, 3D, Audio, Network, Algorítimo e "Base Skill", a única que não pode ser adquirida com cursos de capacitação.

Todos essas categorias que citei anteriormente são divididas em até 3 ramos, são eles, Design(Desenho), Programação e Art, caso você não tenha nenhum proficional preparado em alguma dessas áreas certamente o seu software vai ter deficiencia em alguma coisa.
Além das habilidades citadas anteriormente também há mais dois ramos que são únicos, habilidade em Marketing e em Liderança(Você pode pagar cursos para que seus funcionários aprendam essas áreas também), qualquer funcionário seu com uma boa taxa de liderança pode coordenar uma equipe para o desenvolvimento de qualquer trabalho que estaje sob a sua responsabilidade.
Separadamente o jogador também pode contratar funcionários "secundários", como faxineir@s, profissionais de TI, manutenção, cozinha, entrega, recepcionista e cozinheir@.
Enfim, o jogo resume-se a isso, construir uma central de desenvolvimento, brincar com a arquitetura e a organização dos prédios, criar estacionamento, centro de destribuição, e assim que possível adquirir as empresas concorrentes.

Seguindo o raciocínio lá do começo, o jogo demonstra uma incrível linha de evolução, quando eu comprei ainda estavam implementando o sistema de estacionamento, agora, quando você cosntroi estacionamento seus funcionários vem de carro, e não mais de ônibus, o que vai lhe dar algum tempo de trabalho a mais. Atualmente o jogo ficou um tempo parado pos os Devs tiveram de mudar de escritório, mas agora já estamos recebendo o Alpha9, que conta com mais uma incrível variedade de recursos, o que mais se destacou para mim foi sem dúvida poder imprimir cópias físicas dos seus produtos e distribuir, enfim, [b]o jogo mantém-se em constante evolução, nos bastidores podemos observar uma equipe cheia de potencial e amor pelo que faz, acredito que vale muito a pena, mesmo pelo seu preço integral(diga-se de passagem é muito barato inclusive para nós, R$ 26,99).[/b]

para quem quiser acompanhar de perto os planos, segue o cronograma oficial do que deve vir em cada novo atualização:
https://trello.com/b/9I286Mhu/software-inc

29511937.review:
German Review:

Vorab... Dies ist keine typische Game Studio Sim wie z.B Game Dev Tycoon. Das habe ich tatsächlich auch erst im nachhinein gemerkt, (Hätte besser recherchieren sollen) hat mich dann jedoch auch keineswegs gestört. Man merkt deutlich, dass der Entwickler sich sehr viele Gedanken über die verschiedenen Prozesse gemacht hat und alles mögliche bis ins kleinste Detail ausgearbeitet wird und wurde. Ich spiele zum Zeitpunkt der Review 54 Stunden und ich entdecke noch immer neue Dinge. Davon habe ich die meiste Zeit sogar ohne Mods spielen können (die ich tatsächlich auch erst vor ca. 4 Stunden reingepackt habe, um das mal zu testen.)

Im Prinzip kann ich das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der Bock hat einfach ein bisschen rumzubasteln und ein cooles Software Studio zu bauen und damit den Markt in verschiedenen Kategorien zu erobern.

Wer auf den Wirtschaftsaspekt aus ist, der sollte vielleicht lieber noch ein bisschen warten. Der Teil ist nämlich stark unbalanced. Du baust dir erst ein 2D Editor mit Qualität Outstanding und vermarktest das ordentlich... Wenn du alles richtig gemacht hast, hast du ab dem Zeitpunkt fast schon unendlich Geld. Ich habe mich als OS Entwicklerstudio versucht und habe nach ca. 10 Jahren schon 1.000.000.000€... Balancing lässt also noch zu wünschen übrig. 

Ich sehe das ganze tatsächlich eher als ein "Die Sims - Entwicklerstudio" wo ich einfach nur fröhlich vor mich hinbaue und mir in meinem Kopf eigene Geschichten zusammenspinne. Wer darauf steht, der sollte hier zugreifen!


Fazit:
+ Super gut durchdacht
+ Schöne Grafik
+ Super Spiel zum drauf losbauen

- Aus finanzieller hinsicht noch zu unbalanced
- Könnte vielleicht noch die ein oder andere Komfortfunktion vertragen
- An einigen Stellen fehlt es an Erklärung, warum etwas so ist, wie es ist. (z.B permanent vereinsamte Mitarbeiter, die trotz offenem Büro, einer Lounge, große Kantine und regelmäßigen Teammeetings anscheinend keine Kontakte knüpfen können und daher alle 2-3 Tage in deinem Büro stehen und eine Gehaltserhöhung als Entschädigung wollen...)

29433702.review:
[h1]SOFTWARE INC. REVIEW:[/h1]
This is a review during ALPHA 8 of Software Incorporated. 

I will rate this game amongst sections:

[h1]Design Aspects:[/h1]

Bugness Level:  2/10 | Barely any bugs.
World Design: 5/10 | Not much "Backstory" or "Theme"
System Design: 9/10 | Very accurate marketing systems, and accurate development systems.
Content Design: 7/10 | Good amount of minigames, extra features, and enhancements.
Game Writing: 4/10 | Barely any story.
Level Design: 10/10 | I LOVE THE ART STYLE! Simplistic, yet complicated at the same time! <3!
U.I. Design: 8/10 | Great, but sometimes hard to find things that are buried in lists.
Audio Design: 2/10 | Basically no audio. I recommend listening to some on YouTube, Spotify, iTunes, etc.
Replayability: 9/10 | If you replay it, it is almost a different game every time.
Learning Curve: 7/10 | Shallow learning curve, but a lot of depth. I recommend watching lets plays on this as a tutorial.
Game Feel: 9/10 | Calm and relaxing in some parts, but hectic in other parts.

[h1]Commercial Aspects:[/h1]

Price: 9/10 | Worth the money, Totally.
Development Speed: 6/10 | Updates don't come out very often.
Update Quality: 8/10 | When updates come out, they are usually packed full of content, as can be seen on the Trello.


[h1]Pros:[/h1]
Great Learning Curve.
Good Replayability.
Great Graphics.
Good Concept
Good mod support
[h1]Neutral:[/h1]
Not many mods
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
No Audio

[h1]OVERALL GAME RATING:[/h1]
[h1] [spoiler]9.5/10[/spoiler] [/h1]

29415337.review:
TL;DR Its a great game expessially for the price that keeps getting better.

This is what an Early Access game should be. The periodical updates that add major mechanics are always fun to get hyped about. Not to say this game feels incomplete, It's actually quite complex sofar. This game is the best software development game byfar. The scale is also quite impressive. You start by managing a handful of people, and care about individual products, But as you progress you start training managment to automate hr tasks. At the end game your creating new building in your campus or floors in your mega-office to house entire divisions of employees just to make games or develop os's. Most games don't have this sense of progression where what you do in the late game is totaly different from when you start, let alone the fact that its made by one guy.
