22899407.review:
Que dire de Software Inc. Prnez un Game Dev Tycoon et autres du genre, ajoutez y une touche de personnalité ultra poussé, un management d'effectif précis, ainsi que de décider de la politique de la boite que vous allez monté. En effet Software Inc. permet de faire autres que des jeux et moteur de jeux : OS, Outils audio, Editeur 3D etc... J'ai dis une personnalisation extreme ? Oui, car dans ce jeu TOUT est personnalisable, de l'ordinateur dernière génération à la machine à café (important la machine à café).
Pour que votre entreprise survive et grossisse, il va falloir du sang, des larmes et des millions de lignes de code.Vos début en 1980 seront laborieux, mais une fois votre premier logiciel lancer sur le marché, l'argent tombera dans vos bras.Vous pourrez alors embaucher, puis étendre votre empire. Car SoftWare Inc. incorpore aussi la notion de concurrences, qui sera parfois difficiles à abattre.
En plus de cela, le jeu supporte aussi les mods. Certains rajoute de la difficulté, d'autres des fournitures, ou encore des logiciels en plus (Rajout de composants PC par exemple).

BREF, un résumé :
- Personnalisation énorme
- Un large choix dans notre politique de direction de la boite
- Supporte les mods
- Mise à jour régulière 

Le seul point noir du jeu est ça monotonie. Une fois que l'on vend un produit assez bien, l'argent arrive facilement et on devient le nouveau Google ^^.

Encore désolé pour les fautes de français

22860990.review:
First, let me take you back to a time in my youth. A Commodore 64 and an Amiga 500. Games genres didn't seem to have boundaries and game developers came up with cool ideas and concepts. You could walk into independent stores and see shelves of games you had never heard of, take a punt with your weekly pocket money and usually find an gem.

Then games companies found a "formula", make an FPS or RTS and it's a money spinner. People "designing" games stopped being gamers and devs and started being business men and bean counters. Things got grim...until...indie devs making their ideas into games in their home offices (and normally trying to hold down a proper job at the same time). We got back to the golden years of spending a pocket money amount and finding a gem of a game that is just different.

This game is a "golden years gem". It's different, it's not following the formula. OK there are a few indie games you could say the same of but this game just feels, well, different!

How? Well to start with it's the detail. I'm a software developer in real life, we follow the Agile development process and before that we just did everything sit of pants style. This game allows you to create your software company following (loosely) the same methods. Start off as a 1 man team doing everything very seat of pants. Hire staff, grow, expand your business and offices. As you get bigger then start creating teams of devs and designers to either work on core software or more ad-hoc titles. 

You can choose to be a business software company, games, art packages or do a bit of both. And here is the gotcha, you actually start to "care" about your business and staff, the game draws you in that deeply.

At the point it's still in early access but I've had no issues with crashes or anything major. There are some points that need polish:

-Needs more options on furniture and equipment. 10 years before a computer terminal is upgraded is a long time and we all know tech moves a lot quicker!

-Non-squre rooms are sometimes difficult to recreate with a 2nd floor (walls don't seem to want to snap to endpoint)

-Networks: I'd like to create networks between servers and desktop machines so I can have control over who have access to what

-Accounts Dept: What about adding an accounts team to pay bills, chase detbers etc?

There is a modding ability so I'm sure the furniture issue will get filled quickly by the community though.

On the whole however this is a great game. I can certainly recommend it to anyone who is working in the IT community and even if you're not apart of the IT Crowd you'll still enjoy the game plus get some insight into how these companies work.

Definately worth my pcoket money!

22766634.review:
Habe das Spiel nun knapp 16 Stunden spielen können und ich muss sagen, ich bin begeistert! 
Ich liebe Tycoon, Aufbau, Simulation und Strategiespiele. Sind diese dabei auch noch komplex und geben dir alle Freiheiten, die du dir nur vorstellen kannst werden die Spiele zum MustHave. Software Inc ist ein geniales Spiel, Kenner und Begeisterte von Game Dev Tycoon und ähnliche Tycoon-Simulationen sollten hier unbedingt zuschlagen. Die Möglichkeiten seine Software, wie auch immer diese aussehen mag (Games, Spieleengine, Betriebssysteme, Antiviren, 2D oder 3D Programme, ...) , zu entwickeln und auf den Markt zu bringen sind riesig. Und wer es dabei noch kompliziert mag und sich gerne durch viele Listen, Zahlen und Vergleiche wälzt, ist hierbei genau richtig.

Zudem kommt noch der Aufbau-Anteil dazu. Baue dir dein eigenes Büro so wie du willst, optimiere an jeder Stelle und wachse zu einem Riesen-Konzern.

Kleines Negativ: ich wünschte es gäbe ein paar mehr Möbelsorten bzw. Upgrademöglichkeiten. Momentan stehen 6 PC's für die Mitarbeiter zur Auswahl - was völlig in Ordnung ist. Sieht man sich aber die anderen Gegenstände an (Tische, Stühle, Lampen, Blumen, Fenster, etc...) muss man sich überwiegend mit 2 Sorten je Kategorie abfinden. Ist eigentlich nicht weiter schlimm und ausreichend, mehr Kontent würde dem Aufbau-Aspekt aber noch um ein vielfaches pushen.

Alles in Allem kann ich Software Inc. nur empfehlen!

22742580.review:
Any game that actually gets me to bust out graph paper and start drawing out rooms like it's 25 years ago gets my vote. 

The best way I can describe it is a mashup of franchises like The Sims and GameDev Tycoon. You can be a single employee pounding away on their keyboard in a programmer mini hut, or build a sprawling software dev company complete with underground server room.

You are also given several different ways to bring in money. Develop your own OS, editing software, office software, different CRMs. Don't feel like doing that? Grab some contract work or research some patents for additional income.

Are you a micro manager style player? I am. Assign employees to any team, role, train them however you want. Don't really feel like dealing with all of that? Train up your Leads to manage product development and hiring/firing for you.

Imho, this is already a complete game. As of the time of this review I'm about 30 hours in, putting my investment at around 50 cents an hour. Looking forward to the finished product!

[h1]Give me more![/h1]

This game has so much potential, and such a solid groundwork laid in place, I cannot wait for the developers to build on this. I want more tech, more customization, and especially more risk/reward decisions to increase the challenge. I'm maxed out on the current build, and fleshing out the already good mechanics could make this my favorite office management sim ever.

+Unique look and feel to game
-Basic functions not very intuitive without tutotial
+Tutorials very well written and explanatory
-Not much to do right now once the money starts rolling in
-Not much risk or challenge to game once you've released your first successful product
+Office design is fun
-Not much vanilla customization and relies heavily on user assets in Workshop
-Cannot delegate much leadership functions to leads, why can't they hire/fire employees within user thresholds?

As I said before, this game has the "hard stuff" done already, and already has a lot of fun right now, so I am very satisfied with my early adoption of this game, and if you like management sims, you probably will be too!

Ca faisais longtemps que je n'avais pas pris un tel pied sur un jeu ! Ce jeu est terriblement attachant, c'est très dur de s'arrêter en pleine partie. Software Inc. est un très bon jeu et permet de se détendre assez facilement. Je trouve que le fait de créer sa boite en dur nous même avec autant de précision est un très bon point et c'est assez inovant si on regarde les autres jeux du même genre. Cet aspect est donc intéressant.
Un autre point du jeu qui est assez intéressant lui aussi est le fait de pouvoir faire autre chose que des jeux ou des moteurs de jeux (OS, éditeurs 2d, 3d, audio, etc ...).
Il y a aussi le fait d'être confronté aus autres entreprises et à leurs parutions. Le problème de ce point là est qu'il y a bien trop d'entreprise et ça ne sert pas forcément à grand chose de s'en préoccuper, on devient très riche assez rapidement et même si c'est assez dur de leur passer devant niveau fans, ventes, etc ..., il faut juste attendre et sortir des logiciels en permance.
Aussi, le jeu, c'est peut-être à cause du fait que j'ai fait le choix de mettre deux jours par mois, est assez simple, et comme dit plus haut, on gagne beaucoup d'argent très vite et acheter des objets ou embaucher des employés n'est plus du tout un problème et on peut très facilement se retrouver avec une équipe d'une centaine (j'abuse un peu peut-être) d'employés, si tant est que le joueur à la patience de créer un nombre d'équipes adéquat, de créer tous les bureaux nécessaire et de les assigner aux employés voulus un par un.
Un dernier point, qui n'est pas dans le jeu mais que, justement, j'aimerais voir dans le jeu, c'est la possibilité de rendre multitâche un employé, cela pourrait aider dans les débuts de la partie (par exemple, un employé design/programmation et un autre design/artiste)
Cette évaluation est évidemment faite pendant l'alpha du jeu et je sais bien que le jeu va être soumis à plein de changements  (j'espère en tous cas).
Pour l'instant, je donne un 8/10.

A GREAT START. Support this game if you loved Game Dev Tycoon but thought it was too simplistic and limited.

Mechanically, this is what I hoped and wished Game Dev Tycoon to be, after 4 hours of playing it. The game I imagined in my head when thinking about this theme. Mechanically, it's still not finished, but already very good.

Content-wise, even at this stage, it would need more to really make the mechanics work. More than Game Dev Tycoon, while at this point it still has much less. And what content is there is weakly signalled, or not at all (when do researches become available? where do certain software technologies? why can't I influence that by research? making it more a standard research tree and using the times only at least as a partial lock would benefit the game greatly, I think, the player needs at least the theoretical power to leave competition technologically in dust).

And for the research to work at all, there needs to be more of the content, more of technologies, I was playing until 2020 because I saw the holocomputer in the build menu and I expected a related technology to appear/unlock at which point I was prepared to throw my whole 60people, 30bilion$ company to creating a holographic networked OS... But no technology came...

I have many suggestions that are better placed in forums, I guess. Also, the interface is a bit... obnoxious when you try to manage larger number of people in larger number of teams.

But overall, a great start and it seems dev knows where he's headed, and he's headed to a good place. With appropriate amounts of care, resources and time, and polish, this could become a leader in niche that Game Dev Tycoon kinda pioneered/popularized, this could become "The Sims of gamedev management games". The potential is great, and even in its current state it's lots of fun to play.

22288580.review:
First and foremost I want to compliment the developer. Not only does the developer take an interest in community ideas and suggestions, he implements a lot of them, and asks questions and engages the gamers. Excellent developer for an excellent game.

Pros:
- Excellent simulation of software design
- Multiple teams and strategies to use when running your company
- Diverse set of products to make (see cons as well)
- Very simple to use building designer
- Easily manageable information (various windows, tables, etc...)
- Really makes you feel like you're part of a growing software industry as you go from 1980 onward.
- Realistic staffing simulation (see cons as well)
- Excellent progress and commitment to updating regularly. GREAT Feedback to supporters

Cons:
- Product diversity could improve (planned in future releases already)
- Hiring is slightly flawed (should have limited employees available each month, not unlimited at a price of virtual dollars)
- Graphics can use some upgrades, but it definitely has a unique feel as it currently sits
- Animations can use work, but this game is about gameplay and content above all else, and in that area, it excels.

Overall:
- This is the most UNDERRATED Early Access game on Steam. Excellent business simulation, interesting concepts, great design, simple to use, and challenging to really master. Needs some more work, but is regularly updated by development team (one person!!). Excellent response to supporters, and the Dev takes ideas from fans/gamers and runs with them.

9/10 - Recommendation:  BUY NOW!

22232931.review:
It's an IT engineering/office manager, which for some messed up reason is actually fun to me.

It best compares to games like MadGames Tycoon, GamersGoMakers and obviously the inception of the entire genre - GameDevTycoon by Greenheart games.

The office part is very close to MadGames Tycoon, which means that you are building the entire building. It's not exactly "The Sims", but it gets the job done, once you've memorized the categorization of items. The building part is solid. It all happens on grids, but then again you are building an office and not a theme park. It doesn't throw standard rooms at you. The game gives you the freedom to build and think about your layout and build a muli storied building to be proud of, because those things aren't cheap to build.

Speaking of money, the economy in this game is maybe not the best presented, but DEFINITELY the most detailed of all current indie games about management. It's all there; A field of competitors putting out their games, a stock market of your competitors, including hostile takeovers, aswell as a software market that is ever shifting from one product to the next. Distribution channels matter. Marketing matters. You create your own office and structure it in groups and rooms that help you engineer the software. The other companies will always keep you on your toes!
If you don't have the leading Operating System at the beginning of the Game, there will be a decision to be made: Go with your hope on your own OS, but a small portion of the market, or bow to the big guy and just develop tools for his OS. If you make more money than him that way, you might actually be able to buy the next bigger company. Sweet monopoly!

You can take your company on many paths in the game. You don't have to be a video game company, as in all the other games. You can be the guys that do tech support for other companies and do contract work in separate teams. You can stay a small company and just serve a high priced niché product, like putting out the best 2D or 3D graphics tool. You can be a company that just creates marketing bubbles, etc.

The path to success isn't an easy one at first. You will have to put some effort into the first hours. The way I learned, was to try over and over again on a limited budget, without endulging the 500k starting option, which is also there. If you do well in the beginning, you can take a 100k loan over 2 years and actually pay it back!

The game is steadily developing, but not exactly at the speed of light. The technology is solid and it's completely playable with lots of features. The detail in some parts of the game, makes you wish for even more options and challenges. I literally wished, the game ran at a slower pace, but gave me more trouble in the day-to-day management. I barely remember any of the workers names after a game. They are totally just numbers, because they are looking like little plastic figures.

If I have to fire Karen from accounting (accounting should also be in the game and isn't btw.), it should feel a bit of a downer, because I should be able to see the sad little face afterwards and I'm not, which ironically gives me a sad face, which you can't see either.

TL;DR

Solid stuff; Walls of Numbers; Detailed Market; Learning Curve
buy it, play it, love it. That's what I do.

[b]Pros:[/b]

[list]

[b]Cons:[/b]

[/list]

21917440.review:
This has to be one of the most underrated games on Steam. I missed the release last year and accidentally found the game while searching for games under the management tag, and what a nice surprise it was! This is hands down the best software development game I've played, and there are quite a few in the market now (Game Dev Tycoon, GamersGoMakers, Mad Games Tycoon etc.)

What sets it apart for me is the soft simple graphics and the smooth interface. It is very easy to learn the controls and build big impressive looking office complexes. It also allows you to customize the pace, difficulty and starting locations for varied experiences. In the simulation/management genre, this game is right up there with the best of them.

You start with youself as the founder of the company building a simple little office and starting to work on a few small contracts. From there you start developing your own software: Antivirus, games, operating systems, audio and visual design software, and more. As you grow, you can expand your office and workforce. It's entirely up to you how much you'd like to micromanage. You can assign team leaders and send them on HR and project management courses allowing them to hire and manage teams and their own projects completely independently. The game scales incredibly well as you expand your company.

Some might find the spreadsheets a little overwhelming. I actually like it because it makes my little virtual company feel real. This game was really well thought out and you have all the data you might need at your disposal.

Negatives? Not much. It is early access so there are some glitches, and the game could do with more content. Most notably furniture is currently a bit limited, but that said all the necessary stuff is already there for you to have heaps of fun. There's also some minor balancing issues that will be sorted out later but again nothing gamebreaking and nothing that will ruin your fun. So far the developer of Software Inc. has built a great foundation for what will probably become one of the most unique and fun management simulations on the market.

21847543.review:
I've honestly never played a game with so much potential. Even now in alpha, there's hours of enjoyment to be had. Admittedly, It doesn't take very long to build up your company to endgame level (having so much money you could never possibly spend it, and quite literally dominating the market)

But it is an early access game, and there's incredibly frequent updates. 

[b]The best bits about the game so far (in my opinion) are;[/b]

[list]
[*]Incredibly detailed building mode allows you to construct your very own office for your company, including a basement level and up to ten stories.
[*]Interesting market simulation generates competitor companies and products.
[*]In depth HR management allows you to take control of each of your employees, their salaries, roles, and which team they work in - you can even dictate where they sit and which toilet they use.
[*]Adjustable timescale is incredibly handy, if you want a quick game you can set it up so that there's only one ingame day per month of the simulation (your employees will come in for a days work and the next day will be a new month) and vice versa. 
[/list]

[b]There are, ofcourse things that need some work, and obviously it's a very early alpha so these aren't criticisms -  just things that, in my opinion, aren't all that they could be;[/b]

[list]
[*]Performance, I don't know if this is something the Dev can fix or if it's more to do with the engine - but it should be noted that [i]this game doesn't really run all that well[/i]. I'm playing with a GTX 980 and an i7 CPU and my system is barely keeping up - the game drops frames especially hard when buildings go over a certain size / too many employees are on the screen.
[*]The game is far too easy once you get used to playing. Unlike Game Dev Tycoon which seemed to randomize how well your products would perform - if you make software in Software Inc, it's pretty much guaranteed to sell well unless you make blatantly awful software.
[*]Not enough furniture (not nescessarily important, I just obsess over customizing my office.)
[*]As mentioned earlier, it's easy to make billions in an hour or two and then never have to worry about cash again (aslong as you keep pumping out software) - ideally I'd like to see more ways in which I can spend my money - kind of ties into my above comment but still, it takes some of the fun out of it once you get to Microsoft level of market dominance. 
[/list]

Overall, I'm having fun with Software Inc, and I look forward to each new update. I appreciate that the developer is active and I am convinced that if he continues to put as much effort in as he has been, this is going to be quite a great game once there's more added to it. 

I'd recommend if you're willing to go into the game in it's current state, it is Early Access after all.

Dieses Spiel ist für mich der Inbegriff eines hervorragenden Early-Access Titels.

Der Entwickler geht sehr transparent mit seiner Arbeit um und informiert regelmäßig über den Fortschritt und geplante Features.
Das Spiel selbst ist selbst in diesem frühen Stadium bereits sehr gut spielbar und macht sehr viel Spaß, obwohl natürlich noch einiges an Content fehlt. Dennoch kann man bereits erkennen, wohin die Reise geht und man kann wunderbar einige Stunden mit dem Spiel "verschwenden". Die Grafik ist leicht erkennbar nicht mit einem AAA-Titel vergleichbar, das Spiel besitzt aber dennoch einen eigenen Artstyle. Generell ist die Grafik aber vollkommen ausreichend und zielführend. Technisch sind alle bereits implementierten Features bereits sehr ausgereift und mir sind in der momentanen Version (März 2016) keine großen Bugs aufgefallen. Alles in allem kann ich das Spiel jedem Empfehlen der an Tycoon-Spielen Spaß findet.

Take note that I have been playing on the Alpha 8 [b]unstable[/b] branch.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Already has quite a bit of depth.
[*]The graphics give a nice feeling.
[*]The Developer is quite active.
[*]The game doesn't cost more than $35.

[*]The main menu does a cool thing. (See Note 1)
[*]Workshop integration.
[/list]

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
[list]
[*]The game seems a little unoptimized graphically at the moment, I get 25 FPS with highest settings. (See notes 2 and 5)
[*]The game is a bit unbalanced. (See note 3)
[*]The development cycle is boring and probably too simplified, it is currently just progress bars. (See note 6)
[/list]

[h1]NOTES:[/h1]
[olist]
[*]It shows a little model of your company's building.

[*]Turning off SSAO and Extra Shadows got me back up to a solid 60 FPS. I'm including my PC specs because of this, just in case.

[*]I have heard that the dev is working on balance. The balance issue seems to be that it is easy to make a lot of money. Your very first software could possibly even earn you millions. Also, you seem to always make "outstanding" software if you choose to go through the process completely. The AI doesn't make many like that.

[*]You can follow development on Trello [url=https://trello.com/b/9I286Mhu/software-inc]here.[/url]

[*]I have upgraded to a GTX 1060 6gb. When the new update comes, I will test out how that has affected performance and if I will be able to run it at the highest settings again.

[*]The next update will revamp development, and it should wipe this con off my list.
[/olist]

[h1]PC Specs:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Windows 10 Pro 64-bit
[*]GTX 960 2GB (See note 5)
[*]i5-4670
[*]16 GB DDR3 1600Mhz RAM
[*]120 GB SSD for Sytem, programs, and small games. 1 TB HDD for other storage.
[*]1680x1050 main montior, 1600x900 secondary monitor. Game ran on main monitor.

21570204.review:
Пришло время обновить свой обзор.
([i]слежу за игрой с начала июня 2015 года[/i].)

Software Inc. - это симулятор, в котором вы ощутите себя разработчиком, а в дальнейшем руководителем мегакорпорации. Здесь вас ожидает детальная разработка программного обеспечения: выбор определенных РЕАЛЬНЫХ функций продукта, анализ рынка, маркетинг, пост-маркетинг и т.п. 

Для достижения высот в области программного обеспечения вам придется нанимать сотрудников, следовательно, руководить командами, которые будут состоять из определенного числа сотрудников, каждый из которых имеет свои потребности и характер.  

У каждой успешной компании должен быть свой оригинальный офис, не так ли? Software Inc. предоставляет эту возможность. Вы сможете построить копию здания какой-либо корпорации из реальной жизни, либо же подключить творческие навыки и построить свое, "неповторимое", здание с блэкджеком и серверами! 

Так же, игра имеет очень простой и открытый моддинг в плане добавления программного обеспечения, сценариев для игры и мебели. 

По мне, это новый уровень в жанре "игра про создание игр". 

Из минусов - альфа, которая несет, помимо префикса к версии, некую ограниченность в контенте, которая, лично мне, не мешала наигрывать за одну игровую сессию по 5 часов.

21559698.review: I wish there was an inbetween button for recommendation. I'm really not sure. I used to have a lot of fun with this game, but after not playing it for a few months, I came back and everything is so technical now. It used to be fun to just focus on developing good software, but now you have to micro-manage every little aspect of the process, including printing and delivery. I also run into the problem often where my employees will just sit around, or complain about not having good or a place to pee when there is a kitchen and a bathroom. I'm going to go ahead and give it a thumbs up because it's a good game, and the developer works really hard on it and does frequent updates. However, be aware that, while this use to be a good casual management game, now it has a ton of micromanagement, and it's easy to start bleeding money and go into debt if you try to move past a one person dev team too fast x]. (But I guess it's really good training for learning how to think of business in real life).

21360277.review:
This game is like my weekend crack. I plan to play it for a couple hours, then 14 hours later realize I'm late for work. It's like a rough diamond however, in that it still feels a touch bland and is rough around the edges, but I've been loving it. I'm going to review this game in an as-is state, rather than reviewing it based on what it can be.

Pros:
-Very enjoyable game development sim (I find it more enjoyable than Game Dev Story or Game Dev Tycoon.)

-Building system works amazing. It isn't quite like the Sims or something where you have hundreds of objects to place, but the developer has stated that furniture modding is coming as is more furniture overall.

-Dev listens to feedback and is very active in the community.

-Very large updates, all clear improvements upon the last. Larger than some of the big studios, and nowhere near as buggy as some other EA titles do their updates.

-Modding support (Can mod new software, features, companies, people, etc,) that the dev has plans of making stronger (Looking forward to furniture modding.)

Meh:
-Updates are slow. The game is made by one man, and the updates are large and stable, so I wouldn't say this is too bad of a thing.

-Performance can start to die rapidly if you go overboard growing your company. I can handle up to about 350 staff members without lag, but once I go over a certain threshold I drop to 5FPS in a heartbeat. Keep in mind that there is basically never going to be any need whatsoever for that much staff in the games current state, so this is hard to blame the dev for.

-The graphics. I don't hate them, but I also don't love them. Doesn't detract from the gameplay too much however, and I can still make buildings that look nice.

Cons:
-Very little endgame content. There's a point once you've automated teams to design all the software types and effectively own the entire market. The dev has intentions of working on this however, and so far I've been fine just starting a new save whenever the game gets stale. I did feel like this is something worth mentioning though, as some people hate starting new saves in games.

-Not enough furniture variety, though this is another thing the dev is working on.

-The difficulty curve is a little wonky. I found the game extremely difficult for my first 15 hours or so, but after that point I just sort of figured out exactly how the game works and game became extremely easy in a manner of a few hours. The dev has plans for working on this too.

-I've had the occasional crash, but only WELL into long gaming sessions where most programs and games tend to crash anyways. Hard to fault the developer for this one as well.

-Other than parking lots and roads, you can't do anything with the outdoors other than place more buildings. Outdoor furniture is coming in the next update however, so I will update this review once Alpha 8 is out.

21322235.review:
I'm quite impressed with the depth of this game already, being that it's alpha. You are the founder of a software company who can produce a huge variety of softwares--anything from computer or console games, to OS, antivirus, game engines or audo/video tools. After putting almost 17 hours in I'm only "10 years" into the game. <--you can customize the rate of time flow like everything else. 

The really amazing feature of this game is that you can choose to micromanage basically every aspect of your company, right down to hiring employees, accepting contracts, and distributing the work among teams--or you can choose to automate a good portion of this, hiring "lead" staff who will take over HR and project management duties. Likewise, you can choose to keep your company small and "humble", taking up only a small amount of space and resource, or you can grow it into a mega corporate monster that sprawls and impressively large map.

This is the most in-depth game of it's kind that I've ever played and I'm extremely excited to see where this game goes with future updates.


It does currently suffer from a serious need of background music and more decoration options, though.

21309796.review:
EDIT 2016-09-07: Much content and game play mechanics have been added since I last played back in February, I'm loving it all over again! All the changes have been nothing but good in my opinion. The game is more complex (in a good way) and it feels like it takes longer to reach "the end". Seriously, no complaints - other than I wish it was finished so I could be playing an even better version of this game!

OP:
It is definitely a full-on simulation, I love it! The irony of playing a game about developing software that is itself a piece of software being developed is also amusing (can't wait to see some more real-life 2D/3D art). However, after playing 54 hours in a single game I will probably not play it for a while until more content is added and/or changes are made to gameplay. I reached a self-declared point of endless monotony in the game far earlier than I expected to. It felt like 'The End' of the game. But then, what I find monotonous may be an enjoyable continuation of a simulation to others.

Granted, I played this game on the Medium/Normal difficulty - the alternatives being Easy or Hard - but I would hate to experience Easy. All said and done, I love the game and it was definitely worth the $14 I paid for it. At this point it's just a simultion that "peaks" too early in my opinion, but I have faith it will be improved significantly as it approaches official release.

21300694.review:
With just about 9 hours of gametime, I decided to write a review.
I was quite unsure in advance if this game would have a little more deepness, compared to, say, Game Dev Tycoon. But then, I told myself what the heck and gave it a shot. 

I don't think it would be fair to compare this and GDT. GTD is a ton of fun with some subtle memories for some gamers from the dark eighties, like I am. But Software Inc is different. You would have a lot more administrative stuff to do, and less detailt development work. Which at first plain suXed, but then again, hey, you run a company, you are not a simple game dev'er. 
If you understand the game mechanics, it's quite easy on "easy" and "medium", I hope it will be more challenging on "hard" though, but I haven't tried that yet. 

Undoubtly, Software Inc is highly addictive, be it for building an awesome company HQ, be it for that one uber operating system. Also, it's addictive if you are into micro management stuff!
Only thing is: you will need to be into simulation games. But then, it's great fun to play. 

I am keeping away from the Cons, as this is early access and I am sure the devs will change stuff until the release!


8/10, there's so much potential in Software Inc! If you are undecided: go and grab your copy and support the devs.

I like this game and I love the premise. I personally like the fact that its very complicated since it makes it more of a brain exercise. 

However starting a game is very difficult. The default starting cash is $10,000 (you can change it). The real estate for your first office will cost you half of that. Then you have to pay a crap ton of money for the licenses for your project. I personally found it convuluted that you had 20-30+ operating systems to choose from, all very expensive to acquire licenses. Completely blown away that there were no Open Source license options when starting out, especially since the whole point is to "start lean" and grow into a larger company.

The controls are a bit weird. You use WASD to move around the map and UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT to operate the camera. Personally my natural reaction is to click on the ground and drag around until the camera view is perfect. The developer should change it to this way because WASD+arrows+MOUSE is too much functionality to handle when you are also dealing with a very complex UI.

If I gave it more of a chance I would probably like it more. I love the concept and 80% of the execution is there. I actually prefer it to stay complex as it is because it differentiates it from the other game tycoon games. 

My suggestion is to start the game as a loner in a garage, since that is easier to handle rather than throwing all of these resources at the user from the get go. My $0.02 and I'm glad I could provide an early access review.

20940586.review:
Ever wanted the opportunity to go back to 1980 and create your own software development company? Probably not, but that doesn't mean that you shouldn't do that.

Software Inc. is a game in which you can start with next-to-no money and work your butt off to make the biggest and best pieces of software on the market - including Operating Systems, Game Engines, Games, and more. You start out with a solo developer (who you can customise and name, likely after yourself) and who's stats you can adjust to make them better at things like programming, design, art, marketing, etc...

Once you've built your first office using a system that's simultaneously more simple and more complex than building in The Sims, you're good to get working. Fast forward a few successful releases and you're likely going to be looking at hiring and managing different teams of staff, each of which you can have specialised in one aspect of software development. Personally, I enjoy splitting one team in to three teams, each part specialising in the three aspects of software production - Design, Programming, and Art.

As your bank balance grows, your company grows, the land you own grows, and your buildings will grow. You can start with a room, and eventually own and fill the space equivalent to several city blocks, all because of your successful software company - and this really is just scratching the surface of the game. You also manage company insurance, you can buy and sell stocks, you can sabotage other (computer controlled) companies, buy out companies, buy and sell intellectual property, and much more.

And this is all just in Alpha 7.

If that doesn't convince you, [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRT48VU3K4p2Gj6jHVS1nWLpn6hfAxbBe]these 67 videos[/url] might.

20667408.review:
This is my first game review on steam, mostly because even though I use reviews in my own decision making process when it comes to buying a game I'm rarely left with the urge to try and persuade or deter anyone from taking a chance on the game themselves. Software Inc is like many other early release games in the sense that it's not a finished product, but in my 30+ hours played so far I have yet to encounter any bugs that makes this game unplayable. What makes this game so much different than other early release games is that the developer is still constantly working on it and is providing updates almost every week. I remember struggling pretty hard to get started, but once you get the hang of how the game works its very manageable and fun, and as someone who has played other games of this genre I think Software Inc holds its own. 

The reason I think that people should try this game, and why I decided to write this review is because of the developer's commitment to this game. This is a game that is constantly being tweaked and changed for the better, the developer is entirely transparent about those changes and welcomes the community feedback about what could make the game better. This is a chance for players to watch a game actually grow and evolve, as well as a chance to support a small developer whose actions have very clearly shown that they take pride in their work and have made a commitment to this game and its players. If you enjoy games of the business management / tycoon genre I would strongly recommend it.

20581706.review:
Being a big fan of tycoon simulation and management game, I look forward this game to becoming a big hit in its own right. 

Strengths of game:
- Well-designed mechanics and interactions between different economic strategies that will affect your firm's revenue stream
- Ability to micro-manage your workers (e.g. team assignment, skill training, etc.) and yet flexible to ignore those in later stage of game (i.e. avoid repetitive play issues)
- Clean and bright graphics that makes the game fun to play

Areas to improve:
- Mechanics of stock market, insurance fund (staff retention) and competitive takeovers of rivals can be further polished
- Limited things to buy for the "Sims" aspect of designing office
- Lack of random events to mix things up

Despite what seems like a balanced review above, I strongly urged "tycoon games" lover to give this game a try. Money and time well-spent!

20578435.review: A really well done game but can be a little annoying to get into considering the odd formatting and texty nature of the tutorials. After that the game is more expansive and an improvement upon Game Dev Tycoon (may not be the best reference point but that's what I'm going with). The game offers a nice progression system in terms of the time and the advancement of technology and the range of products that you can develop. Moreover, there is an understated stock system that lets you interact with other companies. Once you really get going, the stock system becomes a joke as you can buy out other companies without any effort. There are contracts to be had with other companies, but they aren't really worth it. The expansion of your company can go almost as long as you would like unless you play in the city. There is always a limit, but you would never need enough people or space that would make you reach that limit. I feel that the game may not go on as long as I would like it to (it becomes somewhat monotonous), but the experience you do get is certainly worth.

20333757.review:
This is a lot like a old old old game called "Free Enterprise", which was basically the same premise. This game, however, takes the simulation factor up a notch. I have nearly called into my real job, just to stay home to oversee the design phase of my pretend OS. 

If you want to talk addictive gameplay, this game has it. I'm constantly manipulating the time compression, so I can skip the boring programming more or less, and slow it way down or even pause it to contemplate what product my team should design next, or how much to deposit in the employee insurance fund (super important to do btw), or hire some new hotshot programmer. Should I re-tile the bathroom floor? I think so. Should I put the server farm in the basement? Yeah, why not? Should I fire Susan, because she hates the company founder and can't even effectively market a simple audio tool? Most definitely. 

This seems like it would just simulate the bad parts of working in a cubicle farm, but I cannot stop refining my strategy when I'm not actually playing. I'd whole heartedly recommend this game. Look at the negative reviews, and you see a bunch of people who played for 15 minutes, couldn't figure it out, and trashed the game play. This game deserves a higher level of player. Perhaps that is you.

I'm really impressed by the development Software Inc has had, and the latest Alpha 6 update blew me away. Ignoring the whole Software part of the game, the building component is spectacular. I'm not much of a builder, but I really had fun with the flexibility offered. Really looking forward to what the next releases and future modding community will bring.

The software aspect of things is pretty neat, if not immediately intuitive. After playing awhile you'll find out which features guarantee success for software. Timing is important; releasing cutting edge software before a competitor will make you millions, but if you're beaten to market you'll lose big. The strategy component is definitely there and if all you want is to make software with a team of people, you can do that.

A few weak spots exist, but the game as a whole is a great experience and better than most Early Access titles out there. The developer recently began working on Software Inc full time, so I have great expectations for future releases.

19803936.review:
Currently I have just clocked in 17 hours as I write this review. 
Firstly I would say that if you are into tycoon games this is a must buy and is hands down my favorite tycoon game for the year, it has been a long time between the last good tycoon game and this one I must say.
                                           [B][H1]****SUPPORT THE DEV PLEASE****[/H1][/B]

Software Inc is an absolute master piece and is only going to get better, when I first watched a "lets play" of this game it was by accident and my first impressions were a little negative based on the current state of the graphics but damn I was wrong and after watching a few videos I was more and more intrigued and really started to warm up to the purchase. It has taken me this long to get my head around the core gameplay as there is a bit of a learning curve but nothing that should prevent you from playing at its full potential.
The gameplay and mechanics have a great amount of depth and work well together and the game is super stable. The ability to build a software company from the ground up is the key nature of this game. You'll build your first office to get started and before long you are running multi stories and building server farms, then there's the employees that are another key aspect. there's not a great deal of objects in yet but what is there is functional and customizable to your chosen color palette(s). Building is pleasurable and the ability to build what you want is huge which brings me to the map size, I would say you will have a hard time filling it especially considering you can go up 10 levels and down 1, the map is massive which gives you free reign to do as you please. I'm hoping to see updated graphics and new objects and styles for customization in future builds.
Now to the core gameplay which is developing software, marketing it and supporting it. There are a number of options for you to choose, maybe an Operating System? (this can take a long time to make) or perhaps a visual program that's linked to a few different OS's? There are different features within your software as well that you can choose to add or not. Put your best design team into action and get that puppy to the development stage, the more time you put in the better the quality, smash the bugs or do half and have your support division take on squashing them as they come up after you've released. Now market the hell out of it until it's not worth it anymore and watch the dollars roll in. Maybe take on some contracts early game to get some funds to kick off that killer program that will launch you into the business world. Once you get your head around multiple teams you could plop down a reception and get paid to develop, design, support or market other companies software. Don't forget to get that server room up and running to help support your online distribution store or for compiling your new code and tackling bugs easier. Maybe you could develop an online OS that requires a server that's running 24/7? 
The options in this game are amazing and I haven't seen depth like this in a tycoon game for a number of years, if your on the fence then check out some game play videos on Youtube and check it out. I would say just go ahead and grab it, the price is actually much less than this game is worth for sure. 
Oh did I metion the mods that are available and easy to install? Well they add new software development options such as Mobile OS, Web Browsers, Forums, VOIP servers. The list is long and once you get your head around the game I would recommend starting a new game on hard with mods and see how you go. 

This game is still in development and can only become exceptional, the tycoon aspects of building a software business are massive with great management aspects all so. 

[B][H1]Rating 8/10 (leaving room for the extra stuff that is still being added)[/H1][/B]

19396309.review:
So I dumped 6 hours into the game, crashed and burned several times, and now ended up with a $550M in cash and $1B in stocks. 

The early parts of the game are very well developed with a good balance of macro/micromanagement. I think the game just needs more polish since many of the interfaces are extremely clunky. I despise those silly radial menues that are so hard to control. They remind me too much of Castle Story.

I also think there is serious feature creep. If I was making this game in the game, it would be a medium scope game with recommended 5 developers being written by a single dev. Stuff like distribution and project/hr management are really good ideas but the amount of code required to make them functional/useful/interesting would far exceed the scope of this game.

Here's some more of my opinions/advice for the developer

-I don't think a UML minigame is medium priority, more low priority.
-Need way better server management system, I mean come on you can't be seriously asking me to manually place 200 servers
-Need better furniture management system, I mean come on you can't be seriously asking me to manually move 200 servers
-IT requirements are too low. I have a ton of servers all managed by one IT guy who works only 4 hours a day.
-AI companies are really weak, by year 4 I was worth double any other company in the game
-There's an opportunity to develop a really cool financial system - play Railroad Tycoon II to get a feel of what I'm talking about. The current system is a bit lacking.
-I don't think loans scale up. The max I could ever borrow is 100K.
-Salary management is a massive hassle. I find myself just hitting accept & close every time because manually going through 50 employees is not worth the 5K/month.

There's a lot of other stuff but the main point is that the game is already pretty fun, don't ruin it with features you can't implement right that will crash/bug out the game.

Congrats on going full time, I envy you.

19389520.review:
La version courte:
Du potentiel, oui, mais un long chemin
avant la fin du développement.
C'est agréable, simple dans les graphismes et
et pourtant bien complexe en gestion, pas mal
de détails, de choix, etc.


Version longue:
D'après ce que j'ai compris, ce jeu est le fruit
d'un seul développeur, qui a laisser son job
fin novembre pour ce consacrer à ce jeu, son rêve.
C'est magnifique de vivre en réalisant ses rêves,
c'est aussi pour cela que j'ai acheter le jeu, 
d'ordinaire j'attend les soldes, et encore + si c'est en EA,
mais là j'ai financer un jeu+la personne qui le développe.

Donc du potentiel, de la motivation et plusieurs modes
déjà disponibles comme les multiples traduction dont le
français (sinon je ne l'aurais pas pris).

La grande question, acheter:  oui ou non? 
Si vous voulez soutenir le dév, voir le jeu s'améliorer,
proposer des améliorations bref le but de l'EA alors oui.

Mais c'est en EA justement, donc à risque par définition, 
un produit non fini, et actuellement il n'y a pas beaucoup
de contenu et des bugs, donc voila pour le non.

En conclusion, si vous le prenez, c'est surtout dans l'immédiat
pour soutenir le dév et donc financer le développement.
Le jeu en lui même c'est pas extraordinaire, c'est même plutôt ordinaire. 
A mettre en liste de souhait et à surveiller mais franchement 
je dirais pas avant 2017 pour avoir des changements significatifs.
Donc c'est jouable, mais on en est encore qu'au début.

*Astuce: pour garder l'intérêt du jeu, il vaut mieux faire 
des petites sessions de jeu avec un ou quelques objectifs
genre embaucher, construire, etc. Sinon c'est répétitif.

Pour la traduction en francais: 
En mod sur le forum ou en lien direct:
http://softwareinc.coredumping.com/forum/index.php?topic=287.0


Edit mars 2016: 

Ca avance, des ajouts dans tous les domaines que ce soit meuble, 
environnement, logiciel, donc c'est positif.
En comparaison, je trouve MadGame Tycoon plus simple et fonctionnel,
mais forcément le travail est pré-mâché en amont, alors qu'ici on doit
véritablement construire son entreprise, les murs, fenêtres, TOUT!
Un exemple, dans MG, on pose un bureau, et voila! Alors qu'ici il faut
d'abord le prendre, le mettre dans le sens voulut, rajouter la chaise, puis
l'ordi et des accessoires au choix, beaucoup de choix.

Le mot clé de ce jeu c'est "personnalisation", comme dans les sims,
mais au lieu de gérer le quotidien la c'est le boulot qu'on a jamais vu
d'ailleurs dans les sims, c'est pas une copie mais bien un jeu original.

Mais, j'attend encore avant de m'investir pleinement dans ce jeu, 
à cause de son statut d'alpha, faut recommencer une partie 
dû à l'intégration de nouveaux éléments, c'est pas fréquent mais
c'est gênant si on a une bonne qu'on voulait garder.

19257926.review:
After putting about 20 hours in, I can safely say that I would recommend this game to a friend that enjoys tycoon/management type games.

What I liked:
- There are not many management games on steam these days that give as much customizing options as this one, you can really build your company wall-by-wall, desk-by-desk, development team-by-development team.
- The beginning of a game is great because there are so many options for income. It's fun being creative and trying different ways of getting your company off the ground.
- After having a scroll through the news, it seems this game is updated pretty regularly and just gets better and better.

What I'd like to see:
- MUSIC! I appreciate all the little sounds (the typing of the keyboard, the birds chirping, etc), but it gets really dry without any music. I suggest something relaxing, something along the lines of the infamous Minecraft soundtrack. 
- The user interface is good for the most part, but there are still some small problems that are fine at first but get very frustrating with repetition. Many of these problems occur because of a lack of information when you need it and the player needs to backtrack through menus to find it. Players get really specific in the discussion board when they address these problems, let's get them fixed!
- I find that the interest on insurace is a bit too high later in the game... 19167926.review:
After playing 50 hours, I can say that Software inc is a piece of art. I've wanted a game like that for so long! I was bored of "Game dev story" and "Game studio tycoon" where you could not design your buildings and really build your company. This time, the tycoon-ish side is very present, with the creativity side! What a good mix! I love this game for everything it brings. You may want to have dedicated graphica for this game though. Audio is still to improve but graphics are stable and well done. I like the fact that you can choose from lots of different settings for graphics. It really surprises me that when I tryed playing this game with my laptop, I had to town down the graphica down a bit. I would say: A decent CPU, minimum 2 cores, dedicated graphics (Playable with 512M but still great with a 256M (Don't expect amazing graphics from your old computer). I would recommend 1GB of video memory for best FPS. With my iMac, I can hardly get 30FPS with high graphics, but it's still very playable. For the audio, you won't get amazing soundtracks (guys, it's still in alpha!!) but I see lots of improvement coming.
My final quote: 4 stars.
I would have payed easily 10$ more for this game. I would also see this version as a release. It is very stable and smooth.

For the developpers (What I'd like to see:)
-Background music as it will bring a better playing experience,
-More simple UI, when I started playing, I could not find all the things easily, but still good,
-Did I said background music?
-Interactive tutorial to give new players a good start,

I would say, buy this game. Just buy it. It's worth your time. Trust me.

Instead of implementing product pricing, a basic set of research, timeline, ect they decided to create a brand new building system rather than tweaking key elements of gameplay.

데브 타이쿤류 게임은 처음 해 봤는데 초반 몰입도가 매우 뛰어납니다.
정말 재밌습니다. 특히, 한글패치도 한국유저분이 만드신게 있어  쉽게 접할 수 있습니다.

장점 : 초반에 매우 재밌고, 메뉴얼 없이 플레이 하면서 배워 가는 재미가 큰 게임.
          체계적으로 게임을 잘 만들었다는 생각이 절로 남.
          심즈 게임 같으면서도 경영시뮬레이션 요소가 특화 된 아주 재밌는 게임입니다.

단점 : 데브 타이쿤류 게임들의 리뷰를 보면 알수 있듯이 초반에 큰 재미가 있는 반면,

          게임이 쉬워지면서 쉽게 질리게 됩니다. 
          특히, 본 게임의  아쉬운 점은 경쟁요소가 부족하다는 점입니다. 
          14~16개의 경쟁 AI 회사들이 인게임에 텍스트로만 존재합니다. 
          AI 회사들의 영업 실적이 플레이어 회사에 비해 매우 낮기 때문에 경쟁이 없다시피해 아쉽습니다.  
          

발전가능성 : - AI회사들과 치열하게 경쟁하는 게임이 됐으면 좋겠습니다.
                    - AI회사들도 맵상에 오브젝트로 구현되었으면 좋겠습니다.
                    - 플레이어 회사가 OS 하나만  잘 만들면  게임이 쉬워지는데, 
                       질 좋은 소프트웨어를 개발해도 다양한 실패 변수가 있었으면 좋겠습니다.


결론적으로 참 잘 만든 게임입니다. 후반 컨텐츠가 빈약하다는 점이 단점입니다.

18592345.review:
To be honest, I go back and forth with how I feel about [i]Software Inc.[/i]. I've had moments where I was like 'yeah this is awesome!' when things were going well with my business, and then there were many more times where I had to just keep starting over and struggling to 'figure out how to be successfull' through watching vidoes for tips. [b]At the end of the day, it has some awesome [i]Sims[/i]-esque building and people-management, but it can get bogged down with text-heavy menus and tons of starting over (at least when you are new at it).[/b]

[i]I hesitate to recommend it outright - it would probably be wise to watch some LetsPlays first to really make sure you know what you are getting into.[/i]

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Graphical style is very nice
+Building and designing office buildings is [i]really fun[/i] here
+Ambient sounds are nice, and the day-to-day gameplay is just as fun as [i]The Sims[/i]

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Being successful, for me, was less of using my intuition and figuring things out, and more of 'learning' how others do it in videos and using that as a springboard
-Menus are very text-heavy, and I am sad to say that many glitch out for me (yeah starting over works, among other tips on the forums, but in a game that so heavily focuses on menus, this is not a fun thing)
-I've spoken with the developer about this, and we agree to disagree, but I need to mention it here: [i]the way the day/month time system is set up in this game is screwed up. As is, one day = one month, and it really doesn't make sense. Is it fixable? Apparently not. Why did we get to this point? Good question.[/i]
-I didn't find it fun choosing some of the options, such as 'personality' of your main character and day-scaling, among others

[b]This is a real niche genre game. I had some fun, but overall I really think the consumer needs to know exactly what they are getting into here.[/b]

18551972.review:
An interesting take on the Software/ Game tycoon genre.  The focus is currently more on the HR and business side then on the software side.  You need to purchase insurance so you can intice better employees, there are a limited amount of features that can be placed on the products you create so the emphasis is when to build it (competing for market share) as opposed to what features you cram in.  For an EA game, it runs fine and once you get a handle on making money. The game is fun but too easy after the first big software deal.

Edit 1/27/16
Still returning to this game. I've enjoyed the updates that happen on a regular basis.  The building system is vastly improved over the previous build.  The developer is obviously spending time and adjusting the game due to to feedback from the community, which is what EA is all about.

I still find that once I'm able to make an outstanding OS there is very little to do as you have all the money you need.  Sure, you can buy out competitors and continue to build staff and develop other projects, but this becomes tedious when you no longer need to worry about how you will pay staff.  

I'm looking forward to more items being implemented in the building mode, and balancing between starting and maintaining.  

Overall still a buy if you dig on these kind of games.  Probably 10-12 hours in your first company, on the current build.

18473398.review:
Now that I have 150 hours into the game I can probably write a review. The game is still early access but is still being developed fairly fast by a one man band and he has a full time job to boot. If you are looking for polished graphics and audio, then this game is not for you (so far).
It's a simulation of you being a software developer/guru. You run your company on one of 3 difficulties. There is mod support too.
Gameplay can be found on Youtube but some of the videos are of some pretty early versions of the game.
What's in the game so far: pathfinding is really good but there is some improvement that is being made, ability to hire, train   (through education or leadership skills) and fire (but there is a penalty for this) workers, bonus items for your workers including managers( called lead in this game), better chairs, room decoration, food and coffee, toilets, windows, lights, heating and air conditioning, servers for control management as well as for web store and online game servers,  software contracts and other jobs(deals) through a receptionist feature, multi-story building (up to 10 stories) and a basement. Recent addition is polygon rooms. There is also an automation feature too!
You get to control the quality of the software you produce at the expense of more time developing and programming. There is also reputation in the game which can influence how your customers perceive you. There is a stock market.
When creating software you can choose to sell to the market, give it away (open source) or use it in-house (this may change shortly so you can use in-house then sell in the marketplace).

Weaknesses: As stated above, graphics and audio leave a lot to be desired but in my opinion are fine as they are. The financial system could be better. I am not a fan of the stock market nor of the financial reporting system for expenses. I did not note above but there is insurance for your employees too!

Overall, I highly recommend this game if you like building and management games. Oh, did I mention Mods? Well, this game can be modded too!

18088663.review:
- EDITADO (09/05/2016):

Como o jogo está em "desenvolvimento" acabei por joga-lo novamente durante um 'bom tempo'.
O jogo ESTÁ AINDA MAIS FACIL!

Algumas coisas que mencionei na analise anterior foram corrigidas, como o fato de escolher o mês de férias, mas ainda não é possível eliminar as férias, por exemplo. É possível extender e diminuir o tempo de trabalho, isso salvo engano não era possível.

O jogo está MAIS DICIFIL PARA COMEÇAR, porém MAIS FÁCIL DEPOIS.
Você, quando começar, terá que fazer os 'contratos', trabalhando para terceiros.

Quando tiver com ~250.000, conseguirá com tranquilidade contratar funcionários e já desenvolver seus proprio softwares.

No primeiro que fizer, irá consegui uns 300.000 já no mês seguinte, já considerando o gasto que era nos meses enquanto estiver desenvolvendo terá uns 450.000 na mão. Com 450.00 poderá iniciar um novo projeto e contratar mais funcionários. Além disso no proximo mês conseguirá mais uns 200.000, então, você começa facilmente a ganhar dinheiro. Haa... Faça um time somente para Marketing, com pelo menos dois funcionários, eles serão bem úteis para fazer  com que venda mais. =)

LEMBRE-SE: 
Veja as datas que irá lançar cada recurso e então faça o primeiro software com tal recurso.


Em umas 6 horas de jogo estou com um save com mais de 10.000.000.000, a empresa possui o maior número de fãs e possui o maior valor dentre todos os outros concorrentes. Salvo enganho publiquei 53 softwares no total.

O jogo é RIDICULAMENTE FÁCIL.



- Analise anterior:

O jogo, inicialmente, parece ser complexo e dar ao jogador grande possibilidade de variação, isso é, parece que realmente terá que fazer muita coisa para começar a ganhar algum dinheiro e passa a sensação que será fácil falir.

Entretanto, o jogo é extremamente fácil.
O jogo segue o ritmo "Publicidade é a alma do negocio". 

Não sei se é porque estou altamente acostumado com jogos "Tycoon", basicamente já joguei todos os mais populares (e milhares de desconhecidos também, inclusive até hoje jogo "Transport Tycoon" em meu celular, para ter ideia).

O jogo entrega a possiblidade de ver lançamentos da concorrencia, estranho é que você não precisa escolher ou anunciar o lançamento para os seus proprios softwares. Sabendo disso é fácil. Lance o que os outros vão lançar, mas, antes deles.

Fiz o primeiro anti-virus, ganhei mais de 15 milhões. Com isso, fiquei mais de 5 anos fazendo um OS, ok. Publiquei o sistema operacional antes de todos (e com reputação "Great") fiquei com 130 milhões. Isso sem ter o número de funcionários minimos e sem ter treinado nenhum deles. 

Uma coisa que achei MUITO RUIM é que os funcionários tiram ferias por conta propria! Achava que o jogo poderia permitir que elaborasse seu proprio contrato de emprego, assim, removendo (ou adicionando) férias ou bônus do sálario, por exemplo. Uma coisa mais complexa seria escolher onde montar a empresa, baseada em "leis trabalhistas" (se houver) de cada país. ;)

Mas, isso não ocorre.

A ideia do jogo é boa, mas, somente a ideia. 

Muita (muitaaaaaaa) coisa deveria ser balanceado.
Não há como abrir 'loja fisica', isso é, seus concorrentes podem possuir lojas (na parada de "Distribuição") e você apenas poderá ter distribuição digital, usando seus servidores.

Dai há outro problema. 
Não há como você escolher onde quer distribuir seu software, o que é falho. Afinal, você pode montar (e ver concorrentes) que distribuiem, mas não pode escolher onde vai distribuir suas proprias criações.

O jogo te obriga a ter servidores locais, isso é legal. Afinal, realmente há empresas que tem servidores proprios para seus softwares. Mas... Pequenos desenvoledores (lembre-se você começa pequeno!) poderiam ter a possibilitar de alocar servidores de outras empresa, pagando por X por seu uso, como ocorre na vida real. Mas, o jogo não tem isso, você tem que usar vários servidores, em cima de uma mesa (kk) quando começa o jogo! ;)

Enfim.
Por enquanto, não recomendo a compra ou aguarde uma promoção de 75%.

Para os 'amantes de Tycoon', não espere muita dificuldade, embora ele aparenta ter.
Esperava uma parada mais dificil. :(

Voltarei a minha procura por mais jogos de administrações, está dificil achar algum novo. :'(

***********A Simulation Games Review************
I cant believe this game is made by a one man band the depth this game goes in to in unblieveable. 
This is the only game that i have come across that gives realistic time for developing a product is spot on. If you have everything checked its takes 4years plus to make. aything less then a year tops.

SGR rating 10/10

17895282.review:
This is a really good use of early access - one guy developing a game on his own who is involved in the community and actively listens to feedback.

Whilst the game looks crude (hence the early access), it does have a charm. The gameplay is already quite deep, with new features being added all the time.

Gameplay-wise, it's as difficult you want to make it. Play on easy with lots of cash at the beginning and gradually buy out all your competitors or play on hard and try not to over-reach as you aim to out-gun the competition with your own OS.

As well as design and development, there is also marketing, education and the stock market to play with.

10/10 would go bankrupt again.

17542801.review: This game is awsome. It is still a bit buggy but hey, its in early access. 17536422.review:
Even for someone with no programming background- this game is by far the most fun tycoon I have ever played! The feeling of being ablee to create every single aspect of your company from the server rooms, to the furniture, to the placement of computers, lounges, etc, and the vast range of software you can create with different sizes and features as the years go by.

I spent 11 hours straight playing this game, and started from a tiny one-room shack to a three story warehouse with fully furnished and decorated workspaces, three lounges, two meeting rooms, and a server room with over seventy servers. My most recent Operating System had been rated Outstanding, and  was close to 100% coverage in the world. I had a distribution channel with multiple physical stores all over america (or so i'd like to think.) 

Pros:
+endless replayability
+customization of almost every aspect of the game
+complicated but fun financial features
+furniture and decorations, for those creative and artistic
+realistic needs of employees (bathrooms, fridges, coffee, nice looking surroundings)
+employees sometimes don't get along with eachother (that's realistic!)
+employee ages
+tons of different software production options
+tons of different features for said production options
+great graphics (imo) and hilarious animations

Cons
-features unlock only as time moves on (research teams in the future, maybe?)
-marketing is too easy (you only need, like two marketers for a company of 26 employees)
-assigning furniture to people is hard (you have to wait for them to sit on the furniture first)
-assigning a specific profession to a room is hard

this was a great game, and I'll keep enjoying it. Buy it!

17434172.review:
Review für die Alpha 5.3:
Sehr nettes Spiel, auch wenn es gerade am Anfang noch etwas schwer zu verstehen ist - schnell reinspringen und sofort loslegen kann man zwar, wird aber wahrscheinlich etwas nach hinten losgehen. Hier sind die Guides zu empfehlen.

Was mir positiv aufgefallen ist: Der Grafikstil ist insgesamt sehr nett, wenn auch kantig. Die Pragmatik dahinter ist aber zu verstehen, denn hier geht es ja eher darum, Spiele zu machen und nicht, den Figuren beim Spiele machen zuzusehen... äh... Spieleception und so.

Soundtechnisch sehr karg gehalten, etwas Musik würde sehr helfen. Auch die Animationen sind nun echt kein Brüller, aber ich habe am Ende auch eher erlebt, dass ich mich auf die für mich wichtigen Dinge konzentriere und nicht den Kastenmenschen dabei zusehe, wie sie Steife auf ihren Tastaturen rumhampeln.

Davon ab gibt es schon viele Möglichkeiten, aber gerade bei der Erstellung von Software wären ein paar Features mehr ganz nett, sodass man nicht das Gefüh hat, permanent das Gleiche in anderer Reihenfolge zu machen. Gerade wenn man viel Geld hat, hat man schnell das Gefühl, dass man ausser der Vergrößerung der Bürofläche und dem Engagieren von mehr Mitarbeitern nichts weiter zu tun hat. 10/10

17279906.review:
Nachdem ich zwischen Software Inc und Game Dev Tycoon schwankte, entschied ich mich nach Lesen der Reviews für Software Inc. Ich denke die Entscheidung war die Richtige. Game Dev Tycoon erinnerte mich bei Allem, was ich sah und las, zu sehr an Game Dev Story von Kairosoft für Smartphones. Zu limitierte Möglichkeiten, etc...

Nicht so bei Software Inc.! Selbst in diesem frühen Stadium wirkt die Simulation sehr ausgereift und authentisch. Man hat auf so gut wie jeden Aspekt der eigenen Unternehmung Einfluss. Sei es das Gebäude, die Einrichtung der Räumlichkeiten, etc...alles ist anpassbar! Auch die Art der zu entwickelnden Software bleibt einem überlassen. Kann man bei Game Dev Tycoon, wie der Name schon sagt, nur Games entwickeln, so entwickelt man bei Software Inc. ganze Engines, Bildbearbeitungsprogramme oder sogar ein eigenes Betriebssystem. All das kann dann vermarktet werden oder dient der hausinternen Entwicklung und und und.

Was Game Dev als Vorteil hat ist die detailverliebte Grafik, aber da es sich hier um einen EA Titel handelt, wird da sicher in Zukunft noch einiges machbar sein. Ich persönlich finde sogar gefallen an den steiffen Mitarbeitern, wie sie auf den Tasten rumpaddeln.

Jeder, der sich fragt ob sich der Kauf des Spiels lohnt, kann nur eine Antwort von mir bekommen: Ja!!!

Wie ich bisher so mitbekommen habe, ist die Community um das Spiel schon recht groß und der/die Entwickler bindet die User stark in den Entwicklungsprozess mit ein.

17145523.review:
(This review was edited twice so please read the whole review.)

This Game has so much potential. Nicely made trailer, great concept, very cheap price and I have a weakness for theses kinds of simulation games. 

But unfortunately I cannot recommend a game that is far from a playable state. The tutorials are very in depth, but they wouldn't need to be if the controls where simpler. 

The method of assigning employees to a team doesn't work. My method of making an employee do it's job is look at the tutorial 50 times, do EXACTLY what it told be to do and it still wouldn't work. (I think it is a bug, which is another reason why I can't recommend)

Also most of the time I had no idea exactly what I had to do after accepting a contract or what was actually required to develop software?

Also lack of any ambient sounds, and main menu music first made me think that the game was broken, but it turned out that it hadn't be added yet.

Its Early Access. I should have expected an unfinished game.

In its current state, I would avoid it. But it has serious potential to be an amazing game. 
I wish the Developers good luck.

EDIT:

Once you get used to the controls, it is infact a great game. And the bug i mentioned appears to be fixed. Hence I now have to recommend this game, although if you want a game where you want to jump right into it, then this isn't for you. You will have to invest a lot of time into it, but it is worth it.

EDIT EDIT: Brilliant Game. Only 1 complaint tho, hiring people and assigning to multiple teams can get confusing, because at 1 point i was hiring for my new game dev team an only realised afterwards that i assigned them all to core by accident.

17030905.review:
This Game is definetly one of the tycoon-like games i enjoyed the most - even if its in Early Access. For myself i find the fine level of detail that is put into the developing of software appealing. As much as I can tell now the developer seems to be active both in supporting the people through the steam forums or by actually developing the game further.

The biggest advantages are micromanagement and the opportunity to develop more than games (Operating Systems or Antivirus Software Kits are just an example). Also the graphics might seem very simplistic - which they are - but for me it gives the game its own charm.

Now for the critics. The difficulty jump between the settings from easy to hard is extremly high so you need to be actually quite into the game to survive there. Also the tutorial may explain everything but it takes quite a while to get through all of it. One should also notice that save games which break sometimes when a big patch arrives need to be planned it.

For all those who are not familiar with buying Early Access stuff: DO NOT BUY STUFF UNLESS YOU ARE SURE WHAT YOU BUY. The games are still developed so give the game a bit more freedom in the negative side. For me it helps to get along with a game principle. Even if you think you wasted money after the buy you can still use that to have some actual fun with the game.

Okey last but not least the conclusion guys.
I love this game from heart, simply because it allows people to actually be the guy developing the game - a big plus if you usually are the consumer in my opinion. I apologize for any grammar or spelling mistakes ( I always appreciate constructive criticism. )

Anyways:
Buy it if you love tycoon games with micromanagement that also involves the not so popular topic of game developing and not playing.
Leave it if you get annoyed fast by having to restart quite a few times and being crazily focused about the graphics. In the end its up to you

16991214.review:
Software Inc. is a combination of Sims and Simcity, in a advanced business style.

Basically, you are playing as a top boss, who have overview and controll of everything in the company you made. You have a overiew your employees, what they need to do, their skills, their negative skills, effectiveness, and can see if anyone is idle, at work, sick or at home.

In the game you will have a overview as a leader to make your  employees do assigned jobs, which you agreed to with other companies. There will be a payment, marketing, successrate, and overall overview of groups people are assigned into. You can assign groups for different people, with different skills for different rooms. - Also, you can hire cleanup crew, It-supporter, receptionist etc. If you make a good profit you can make contact to shops for phsycal copies etc. etc.

Everything has it effect on the game. If you make a company without cooling, your servers will be have critical issues, and of course the game will have more content besides this.

Overall designing of the game is really good. I don't like how you must make rooms to the last wall, instead of using the "sims skill" for making anything around cornors or that there isn't any music / bagground / in-game music. Without the music, you will feel a bit of emptyness which might let you quit unless you got a touch for the game it self. 

The game it self has surprisingly alot to offer, where i would mark this game for the advanced user who like to have control of every single detail etc. insurance. So if you like advanced games that's "Sims mixed up with simcity" look a like, where you can touch any detail, which you do in-real life aswell, then this game is for you. 

If you think something else, well. Here is a demo: http://www.twitch.tv/theearlyaccess/v/7324143

16921775.review:
Software Inc. is a fun little management game where your company starts as one person in 1980 and turn that (aka your person/ the founder) into a large company by whatever year you want, depending on how you play. You can do contracts that'll make or break the start-up of your company and make IPs and products that'll also make or break your reputation and income for your whole company. It's a fun game that'll have you addicted from the get-go. Heck, you can even become EA in a sense and buy out the competition! If you're not a fan of management games, then you probably shouldn't buy it then if that's the case. All-in-all, it's a wonderful game that has promise and it's currently worth the whole $11.99 USD. Also he is planning to raise the price of the game when it gets closer to completion, or out of early access. But it'll still be worth the price then, right? .......Right!?

[i][u]If you don't want to read any of that above, just read below for what might be a shorter, fun, summed-up version of this game.[/u][/i]

Pros:
- You can create your own building for your company.
- You are able to choose what year you start in, how much money you start with, the difficulty, and how your character looks.
- You can make or break your company, depending on the difficulty and what-not.
- Color customization is limitless. Basically you can make your building be the rainbow. *(Just can't taste it. ;P)
- You can hire (and fire) employees, raise or lower their payroll, etc. Also, they have needs as well.
- There is a good amount options along the lines of the displayed currency in-game (USD, Euro, etc.)
- You can buy stock from other companies but, if you buy all of that company's stock, then basically....
- **YOU CAN LITERALLY BECOME EA.
- And more that you can find out yourself, ya lazy son of a gun. :P

Cons:
- Customization (which is along the lines of how your character looks physically, building textures, and furniture) is somewhat limited at the moment.
- The game can get boring if you do set the 'days per month' option at the max amount of days, which is 8 days per month.
- The game may or may not lag a little when there are more people on the screen. All depends on how your rig is set up.

16772514.review:
When I was younger I dreamed of being a game developer. Then I grew up and realized how gosh darn hard that really can be. Software Inc totally takes out the middleman and lets you live out your gaming fantasies, in extreme micro management detail and complexity. Rise from a lowly developer all the way to a mega mogul, who has no soul. As you buy out your enemies and release "Skylight 98" a new OS that will earn you so much cash you literally won't know what to do with it. Software Inc comes with quite a steep learning curve, from stocks, retail, development, HR, insurance, you will manage every facet of a business in the gaming/technology industry. What makes Software Inc beautiful is it also allows you a great amount of freedom how you go about it. You can construct your own headquarters, choose your employes and design your own CEO. Once you master the systems in place, Software Inc truly shines and suddenly 40 hours of your life are gone. The only negative thing I can think of to say about Software Inc is that the game still needs quite a bit of personality injected into it. There isn't any music and most of time your staring at menus, this isn't really anything major given the nature of tycoon games and the fact this title is still in Early Access/Alpha. So if you're looking for a business management game with a focus on taking over the world of gaming. Software Inc is the game you've been looking for, and its not even done yet.

I made a video preview to show off some of the features and gameplay of this game!
https://youtu.be/zGjkDIG6qg8
I hope you enjoy!
